0.title: Temples damaged by Portuguese should be reconstructed in state: Goa CM
0.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Sunday said that the temples damaged by the "Portuguese" should be reconstructed in the state. "Till date, the tourists were attracted only to beaches but now it's our duty to bring them to temples," Sawant added. The allocation from the budget for reconstruction of temples has already been made, Sawant stated.

1.title: Entry to religious institutions should be at certain age: Assam CM
1.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday said entry to any religious institution should be allowed at an age when students can make their own decisions. "Madrasa should be a system of education that can give students the choice to do anything in the future," Biswa added. "Admitting children in madrasas is a violation of their human rights," Biswa stated.

2.title: I have a secret Instagram account to check links friends send me: Musk
2.article_body: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk while replying to a follower, revealed that he has "a cheesy secret Instagram account" to click on links that friends send him. He was replying to a Twitter follower who said that many people thought Musk ran his Twitter account, to which Musk replied, "I don't have a burner Twitter account!"

3.title: 38-year-old man gets life term for killing mother-in-law in Pune
3.article_body: A sessions court in Pune has sentenced a 38-year-old man to life imprisonment on charges of murdering his mother-in-law due to frequent domestic issues. The accused was arrested in October 2015 after his mother-in-law was found dead with multiple injuries from a sharp weapon. The court also imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on the accused.

4.title: Wanted to drink with Anil but he said 'we can act it out': Varun on 'JugJugg..'
4.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan, while talking about a drinking scene in his upcoming film 'JugJugg Jeeyo', said that he wanted to actually drink for the scene. "I wanted to actually drink because I wanted to have a drink or two with Anil [Kapoor] sir. But he was like, 'We don't have to. We can just act it out'," he added.

5.title: Saudi Arabia bans travel to India, 15 other countries due to COVID-19
5.article_body: Amid rising cases of COVID-19, Saudi Arabia has banned its citizens from travelling to 16 countries, including India. The other nations include Lebanon, Syria, Turkey, Iran, Afghanistan, Yemen, Somalia, Ethiopia, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Libya, Indonesia, Vietnam, Armenia, Belarus and Venezuela. The administration added that zero monkeypox cases have been detected in the country.

6.title: Man kills roommate after argument over cleaning house in Navi Mumbai
6.article_body: A 27-year-old man, Manoj Pulvanath Medak, stabbed his 20-year-old roommate, Debajit Dhandhiram Charoh, after an argument over cleaning the house in Navi Mumbai. Police said that Charoh would always be drunk after work and would ask Medak to do the household work. This time, Charoh threw a wooden plank at Medak during the fight, after which Medak stabbed him.

7.title: My demand is for culprits to be hanged to death: Wife of man killed in Hyd
7.article_body: Wife of 20-year-old Neeraj Panwar, who was killed in Hyderabad's Begum Bazar, said her demand is for culprits to be hanged to death. Neeraj was murdered allegedly over his intercaste marriage. Four relatives of his wife, including a minor, were arrested in case. The relatives were reportedly provoked by Neeraj's frequent visits to their locality after marrying against their wishes.

8.title: Kane Williamson blessed with a baby boy, shares pic
8.article_body: New Zealand and SRH captain Kane Williamson has been blessed with his second child, a baby boy. The 31-year-old took to Instagram to share a picture of his wife Sarah Raheem holding their children. He wrote, "Welcome to the whānau little man!" Several cricketers, including Rashid Khan and Ajaz Patel, congratulated the couple.

9.title: Mera naam Wizuki hai, you're welcome in Japan: Class 5 Japanese boy to PM Modi
9.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi reached Japan on Monday to participate in the Quad summit. A Class 5 Japanese boy welcomed PM Modi outside his hotel in Tokyo, saying, "Mera naam Wizuki hai...Japan me aapka bahut swaagat hai (My name is Wizuki. You're welcome in Japan.) PM Modi replied, "Waah! Where did you learn Hindi from? You know it pretty well."

10.title: How does the final IPL 2022 points table read?
10.article_body: PBKS defeated SRH in the last match of league stage in IPL 2022. PBKS finished sixth on the points table with 14 points, while SRH finished eighth on the points table. Table-toppers GT were the only team to win 10 matches in the league stage, while CSK and MI lost 10 matches each.

11.title: Power cuts in several areas in Delhi due to storm, flight operations disrupted
11.article_body: Rain and heavy winds lashed Delhi on Monday, causing power cuts in several parts of the city. Flight operations at the Indira Gandhi International Airport were also disrupted. "Due to bad weather, flight operations at Delhi Airport are affected. Passengers are requested to get in touch with the airline concerned for updated flight information," Delhi Airport said in a tweet.

12.title: Delhi govt planning 45-km-long passage along Asola Bhatti Wildlife Sanctuary
12.article_body: Delhi government is planning to construct a 45-km-long peripheral road alongside the Asola Bhatti Wildlife Sanctuary border, which will function as a patrol passage to boost security. "We've witnessed several incidents of encroachment and trespassing on forest land...anti-social elements also create problems at night. So, this corridor will help us in securing the area," a senior official said.

13.title: Does BJP want to submerge Delhi?: AAP as MCD delays cleaning drains
13.article_body: AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Sunday asked BJP leaders "if they intend to submerge Delhi" as BJP-run MCD has "not [started] cleaning 95% of drains". "60 foot and smaller drains...come under BJP-run MCD's jurisdiction. These drains aren't yet cleaned even as monsoon is knocking at the door," Pathak said. BJP is playing with lives of lakhs of people, he added.

14.title: They hardly left home: Neighbour of 3 women found dead in Delhi
14.article_body: A day after 54-year-old Manju Devi and her two daughters, Ankita and Anshika, were found dead at their home in Delhi's Vasant Vihar, their neighbour Pammi said the family hardly left their house. "We only saw Anshika leaving the house to buy groceries or feed dogs...We knew their financial condition and offered to help but they refused," Pammi said.

15.title: PBKS chase down 158-run target in 91 balls against SRH, finish 6th on points table
15.article_body: PBKS chased down a target of 158 runs against SRH in 91 balls in the last league stage match to record their seventh victory in IPL 2022. With the victory, PBKS ended their IPL 2022 campaign by finishing sixth on the points table with 14 points. Meanwhile, SRH finished eighth on the points table with 12 points.

16.title: Successful eradication of polio will be super joyful: Bill Gates
16.article_body: Microsoft's Co-founder Bill Gates said, "If we do succeed in polio eradication, that will be super joyful," on being asked about one thing he's bought that's brought him the most joy. "The thing that has succeeded the best so far...is funding vaccines for poor countries through GAVI," Gates added. He further said that he likes burgers and nice tennis racquets.

17.title: Karma is a b***h: Payal as Kangana's 'Dhaakad' records low opening
17.article_body: Payal Rohatgi shared two screenshots on Instagram. The first screenshot was an article which read that Kangana Ranaut's 'Dhaakad' was set to earn ₹50 lakh on Day 1 and the second was an old tweet from Munawar Faruqui. "Karma is a b***h," Payal wrote. "The one who got 18 lakh votes didn't promote the film," she added referring to Munawar.

18.title: 15% export tax may force steel firms to cancel EU orders: JSPL MD
18.article_body: The 15% export tax imposed on eight steel products by the government could force steel companies to cancel European orders and suffer losses, Jindal Steel and Power's (JSPL) Managing Director VR Sharma told Reuters. "[Govt] should've given us...at least 2-3 months of time," Sharma added. He further said that Indian steelmakers have about 2 million tonnes in pending export orders.

19.title: Saudi Arabia bans travel to India, 15 other countries due to COVID-19
19.article_body: Amid rising cases of COVID-19, Saudi Arabia has banned its citizens from travelling to sixteen countries, including India. The other nations include Lebanon, Syria, Turkey, Iran, Afghanistan, Yemen, Somalia, Ethiopia, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Libya, Indonesia, Vietnam, Armenia, Belarus and Venezuela. The administration added that zero monkeypox cases have been detected in the country.

20.title: Part of 8,000-yr-old human skull found by kayakers in a US river, pic surfaces
20.article_body: Two kayakers recently discovered a partial human skull in a river in Minnesota, US and experts have now determined that the skull is around 8,000 years old. A forensic investigation revealed that the skull is likely that of a man who lived between 5,500 and 6,000 BC. The skull has a depression indicating cause of the man's death.

21.title: Centre trying to connect startups to its ecosystem: MoS IT
21.article_body: Union Minister of State (MoS) for Information Technology Rajeev Chandrasekhar, while addressing students at Gujarat University on Sunday, said, "Innovation, innovation and innovation is the mantra going forward...Our startups and entrepreneurs will drive the Indian economy towards $5 trillion." He further said that the Centre is making efforts to connect startups with its ecosystem.

22.title: 10-year-old girl from Mumbai climbs Mount Everest base camp
22.article_body: A 10-year-old girl from Mumbai has become one of the youngest mountaineers to climb Mount Everest base camp located at a height of 5,364 metres. Class 5 student Rhythm Mamania completed the trek in 11 days with her parents on May 6. Mamania, who's a national level skater, reportedly didn't get any formal training before the trek.

23.title: India sends relief aid worth over ₹43 crore to crisis-hit Sri Lanka
23.article_body: An Indian ship carrying relief aid including food supplies and medicines reached Sri Lanka's Colombo on Sunday as the latter grapples with economic crisis. The consignment, loaded with supplies worth over LKR 2 billion, (₹43.8 crore) was flagged off from Chennai by Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin. India also sent 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel to Sri Lanka on Saturday.

24.title: Govt wanted to convert stadiums into jails for protesting farmers: Kejriwal
24.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while speaking in Chandigarh on Sunday, said the Centre wanted to convert stadiums into jails to arrest farmers protesting against farm laws, but he didn't give permission. He was accompanied by Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann. "The farmer's agitation was for entire country and not just for...Punjab or Haryana," Kejriwal added.

25.title: Man City score 3 goals in 5 minutes on final day, win 4th Premier League title in 5 years
25.article_body: Manchester City defeated Aston Villa 3-2 on final day to win their fourth Premier League title in five years. Trailing 0-2, Manchester City's İlkay Gündoğan scored in the 76th minute before Rodri equalised in the 78th minute. Gündoğan scored the winning goal in the 81st minute. Manchester City finished the season with 93 points, one point more than second-placed Liverpool.

26.title: Former diplomat shares pic of India, says 'It's not Europe but clean & green Shimla'
26.article_body: Former Norwegian diplomat Erik Solheim on Sunday tweeted a picture of Shimla and wrote, "This is not Europe but clean and green Shimla." "Thank you...for constantly showing the world, the beautiful side of India," a user reacted. Earlier, he had also shared an aerial picture of a beachside road in Karnataka's Udupi, calling it 'world's most beautiful cycling route'.

27.title: Ranveer, Deepika party with Rebecca Hall at Cannes, pics surface
27.article_body: Pictures of actor Ranveer Singh and actress Deepika Padukone partying with British actress Rebecca Hall at the Cannes Film Festival have surfaced online. Deepika is a jury member at the ongoing 75th Cannes Film Festival. Earlier, Deepika and Rebecca had walked the red carpet together at the Cannes Film Festival.

28.title: Govt issues 'high' severity warning for Apple's iPhone, iPad, Watch users
28.article_body: The government's Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) has issued a "high" severity warning for Apple's iPhone, iPad, Watch users and a "critical" level warning for Mac users. "Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported...which could be exploited...to execute arbitrary code...and cause denial of service conditions on targeted system," CERT-In said, urging users to apply appropriate updates.

29.title: Religion never teaches animosity: Rahul Gandhi on Neemuch killing
29.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while condemning the killing of a 65-year-old mentally unstable man in MP's Neemuch, said, "Religion never teaches animosity." Taking to Facebook, Gandhi wrote, "The fire of hate turns men blind and when politics preaches hate, men turn into each other's enemies." Congress leader Kapil Sibal also said, "I'm ashamed that this is happening in my country."

30.title: FRL independent directors facilitated fraudulent transfer of stores: Amazon
30.article_body: Amazon accused the independent directors of Future Retail (FRL) of facilitating "fraudulent" transfer of 835 stores to Reliance Group. It said the "narrative" of failure to pay "huge outstanding rent" to Reliance was a "sham" and that in January, FRL had said its outstanding rent was only ₹250 crore. The handover was a way to "alienate" retail stores, Amazon said.

31.title: Felt energetic & all charged up after losing 98 kgs: Ganesh Acharya
31.article_body: Choreographer Ganesh Acharya said he felt "energetic" and "charged up" after losing 98 kilograms. "This was the best phase to take up a high volume of work...also pursue a little bit of acting," he added. "With pandemic slowing down now and industry running back on track, I have many big projects lined up for this year and next," Ganesh stated.

32.title: Paytm forms general insurance JV, to invest ₹950 cr in 10 years
32.article_body: Paytm parent One97 Communications said it has formed a joint venture general insurance company in which it plans to invest ₹950 crore in 10 years. Following the investment, Paytm will hold 74% stake in Paytm General Insurance, while CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's VSS Holdings will have a 26% stake. Recently, Paytm's proposed acquisition of Raheja QBE General Insurance was terminated.

33.title: Bangladesh announces health alert amid monkeypox outbreak
33.article_body: Bangladesh has declared a health alert amid rising monkeypox cases around the world. Although no monkeypox case has been detected in Bangladesh yet, incoming foreign travellers from countries where cases have been found will be screened at land, air and seaports. At least 12 countries, including the US, Portugal, UK and Israel, have reported monkeypox cases so far.

34.title: Indian Air Force evacuates people hit by floods in Assam
34.article_body: Continuing its relief efforts in flood-hit areas of Assam, the Indian Air Force evacuated citizens and provided relief material to areas cut off due to the floods. The Air Force has deployed its transport aircraft and helicopters for the task. A total of 26,236 stranded persons have been rescued so far, as per an official bulletin.

35.title: Held direct talks with Turkish Prez Erdoğan: Finland Prez on NATO bid
35.article_body: Finland's President Sauli Niinistö said on Saturday that he had held "open and direct" talks with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdoğan to discuss Finland's NATO membership bid. Turkey has questioned Finland and Sweden's membership in alliance, stating that the countries have ties with a Kurdish militant group. Finland and Sweden need all 30 NATO members' approval to join alliance.

36.title: Kartik trained for a week for Tandav scene in 'Bhool...': Report
36.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan reportedly underwent training for a week for his Tandav scene in his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "It is a very difficult dance form for someone who has never learnt Indian classical dance," a source stated. "Kartik managed to grab it and how within a week's training under Guru Chinni Prakash," the source added.

37.title: Octopuses eat themselves after mating due to chemical shifts in their bodies: Study
37.article_body: Octopuses torture and eat themselves after mating and before their eggs are hatched due to three chemical changes in their bodies, a new study said. After they lay their eggs, levels of pregnenolone, progesterone hormones and toxic 7-DHC compounds increase in octopuses' bodies. This leads them to beat themselves against rocks, tear their own skins and eat their own arms.

38.title: 'RRR', 'KGF', 'Pushpa' raised the bar of Indian cinema: Karan Johar
38.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, speaking about the success of 'RRR', 'KGF' and 'Pushpa: The Rise', has said, "They have raised the bar of the Indian cinema." "Prashanth Neel ('KGF' director), SS Rajamouli ('RRR' director) and Sukumar ('Pushpa: The Rise' director)...told us how big our standard can be and how far we can reach," Karan stated.

39.title: Cinema not about language, it's about story, emotions: Adah Sharma
39.article_body: Actress Adah Sharma has said that cinema is not about language, adding that cinema is a universal language. "I...speak Marathi and Hindi. We speak Tamil at home. I learned Telugu when I started working in the Telugu film industry. And I speak fluent sign language," the actress added. Adah further said that cinema is about stories, emotions and skills.

40.title: India detects its first cases of BA.4 & BA.5 variants of COVID-19
40.article_body: The first few cases of the BA.4 and BA.5 subvariants of the Omicron COVID-19 variant have been confirmed in India by the Indian SARS-CoV-2 Consortium on Genomics (INSACOG). A 19-year-old female in Tamil Nadu and a South African traveller in Hyderabad have been found positive for BA.4 subvariant. An 80-year-old Telangana man has been found positive for BA.5 subvariant.

41.title: Video shows boy kicking school girl in Jharkhand, CM seeks action
41.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media showing a boy kicking a school girl in a field in Jharkhand's Pakur district. In the purported video, the girl is seen wearing a school uniform. Chief Minister Hemant Soren has asked the police to investigate the matter and inform him after taking action against the accused.

42.title: I wanted to be pilot, 'Top Gun: Maverick' life-changing: Tom Cruise
42.article_body: Hollywood actor Tom Cruise has said that all he ever wanted to be was a pilot or an actor, adding that 'Top Gun: Maverick' was life-changing. "I got to actually fly in an F-14 jet which was a dream come true...The P-51 Mustang you see in the movie is actually my plane," he added. The film was screened at Cannes.

43.title: Crypto regulations will bring peace, more certainty: CoinSwitch CEO
43.article_body: CoinSwitch Kuber's CEO Ashish Singhal has called for regulations in the crypto sector, saying it will bring "peace" and "more certainty". Singhal told Reuters, "Users don't know what will happen with their holdings - is government going to ban, not ban, how is it going to be regulated?" He further said that India should develop a set of crypto laws.

44.title: Putin's missile beheaded my 18-yr-old son, I screamed when I saw him: Ukrainian woman
44.article_body: A Ukrainian woman has said that one of Vladimir Putin's rockets beheaded her 18-year-old son, adding, "I fell to my knees and screamed when I found him like that. I screamed, 'My son, my son, my son!'" "Shrapnel had taken off his head as he bent down trying to shield his girlfriend," she added. His 18-year-old girlfriend also died.

45.title: Scene showing Sidharth Shukla's death cut in 'Jeena...' song: Vishal
45.article_body: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Vishal Kotian has revealed that the death scene of late actor Sidharth Shukla was removed from the latter's song 'Jeena Zaroori Hai'. "We didn't want to keep it as it would have been gruesome. If he was alive, we would have kept the scene," he stated. Sidharth passed away, aged 40, due to a heart attack.

46.title: UK wants to send weapons to Moldova amid Russian threat: Truss
46.article_body: The UK wants to send modern weaponry to Ukraine's neighbouring country Moldova to protect the latter from Russian threat, UK's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss has reportedly said. "Putin [wants to] create a greater Russia...Just because his attempts to take Kyiv weren't successful, doesn't mean he's abandoned those ambitions," she added. Moldova is not a member of NATO or the EU.

47.title: Expecting RBI to lift curbs in 3 to 5 months: Paytm Payments Bank
47.article_body: Paytm Payments Bank expects the RBI to lift the curbs it put on the company in the next three to five months, Paytm's Group CFO Madhur Deora told Reuters. In March, RBI ordered a comprehensive audit of the bank's IT systems and barred it from taking on new customers citing "material" supervisory concerns. The bank is assisting RBI, Reuters reported.

48.title: 2,000 acres of encroached land freed in 2 months in Punjab: AAP
48.article_body: AAP on Sunday tweeted that 2,000 acres of encroached land in Punjab has been freed in the last two months. "Without running bulldozers, AAP government is removing encroachment with the public's help," AAP said. "I appeal to those who have illegally occupied...land...to leave the illegal possession by May 31," Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann had tweeted on May 11.

49.title: Video shows the moment lion bites off finger of zookeeper teasing it in Jamaica
49.article_body: A video showing a caged lion biting off a zookeeper's finger in front of visitors in Jamaica has surfaced online. The zookeeper could be seen teasing the lion through its cage before it gripped his finger in its mouth. "When it happened, I thought it was a joke. I didn't realise the seriousness of it," a visitor said.

50.title: No support from govt needed this fiscal: Punjab & Sind Bank MD
50.article_body: Punjab & Sind Bank is sufficiently capitalised to meet expected credit growth in the current fiscal year and may not need support from the government, MD and CEO S Krishnan said. He added that the bank's capital adequacy ratio improved to 18.54% in March 2022 from 17.06% in March 2021. During FY22, the government infused ₹4,600 crore in the bank.

51.title: Told JP Nadda about BJP's shortcomings in Bengal, Kerala: Arjun Singh
51.article_body: Ex-BJP West Bengal Vice-President Arjun Singh said that he had spoken to BJP National President JP Nadda about the party's shortcomings in Bengal and Kerala. "[Nadda had] said that he'll think about it...It's upon the party as a whole how it'll tackle them," he added. Singh, who's BJP's Lok Sabha MP from Barrackpore, rejoined TMC after three years on Sunday.

52.title: 6-yr-old dies after being rescued from 100-ft-deep borewell in 9-hour op in Punjab
52.article_body: A six-year-old boy who had fallen into a 100-feet-deep borewell in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Sunday died at a hospital after being rescued. The rescue operation continued for nine hours. The boy had climbed a borewell shaft when some stray dogs started chasing him. It was covered with a jute bag and could not withstand his weight.

53.title: She's staying with another man in my house: Actor Karan on estranged wife Nisha
53.article_body: Actor Karan Mehra has claimed his estranged wife Nisha Rawal has been staying with "another man" in his house for the past 11 months. "He has entered my house, leaving his wife and children," said Mehra, adding that Rawal and the man have 'snatched' his properties, cars and businesses. Rawal had accused Mehra of domestic abuse last year.

54.title: DC skipper Rishabh Pant has got my full backing: Head coach Ponting
54.article_body: Delhi Capitals head coach Ricky Ponting has said that captain Rishabh Pant has got his full backing after DC were knocked out of IPL 2022 playoffs race by Mumbai Indians on Saturday. "No doubt in my mind...Rishabh, even in the last season, was the right choice for the captain...He's just a young man and still learning captaincy," Ponting added.

55.title: Former champion Garbiñe Muguruza knocked out of French Open 2022 in first round
55.article_body: World number 10 and Roland Garros 2016 champion Garbiñe Muguruza was knocked out of French Open 2022 in the women's singles first round. Muguruza lost 6-2, 3-6, 4-6 to world number 46 Kaia Kanepi in two hours and six minutes. Meanwhile, world number six Ons Jabeur also crashed out of the tournament after losing to Magda Linette in first round.

56.title: Number of monkeypox cases in 12 countries released by WHO
56.article_body: The WHO has released the number of monkeypox cases reported in non-endemic countries between May 13 and 21. Spain, UK and Portugal have 21-30 confirmed cases, with Spain having 6-10 suspected cases. While Canada has 1-5 confirmed cases, it is believed to have 11-20 suspected cases. Meanwhile, US, Germany, Australia, Italy and France are among the nations with 1-5 cases.

57.title: All local languages are national languages under NEP: Union Minister
57.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said on Saturday that all local languages in the country are deemed as national languages under the new National Education Policy (NEP). "The local languages are no less important than any other languages used in this country, be it Hindi or English. This is the main feature of this NEP," he added.

58.title: Kylian Mbappe extends contract with Paris Saint-Germain until 2025
58.article_body: Paris Saint-Germain forward Kylian Mbappe has extended his contract with the club until 2025. This comes after several reports had stated that Mbappe would be joining Real Madrid on free transfer once his contract with PSG runs out. "I'm convinced...here I can continue to grow at a club that provides everything necessary to perform at the highest level," he added.

59.title: SRH to bat first against PBKS in last league stage match of IPL 2022, playing XIs out
59.article_body: SRH won the toss and elected to bat first against PBKS in the last league stage match of IPL 2022 on Sunday. SRH are being led by Bhuvneshwar Kumar in the absence of Kane Williamson. Romario Shepherd and Jagadeesha Suchith have been included in SRH's playing XI, while PBKS have included Nathan Ellis, Shahrukh Khan and Prerak Mankad.

60.title: Heaps of garbage seen in Kedarnath amid Char Dham Yatra, pics surface
60.article_body: Pictures and videos shared by the media have shown piles of garbage and refuse strewn about at campsites in Uttarakhand's Kedarnath amid the Char Dham Yatra. This came as the Yatra resumed this year after two years of suspension due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The increased human activity and garbage are destroying the area's flora, experts have warned.

61.title: Farmers can topple governments: Telangana CM KCR in Punjab
61.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday, after paying tribute to the farmers who died during the anti-farm laws protests last year, said, "Farmers can topple governments." Urging farmers' leaders to not stop their agitation against the Centre, Rao said, "We...would always support our farmer brothers and sisters." Telangana is improving, giving farmers free electricity, he added.

62.title: FPIs remain net sellers, withdraw ₹35,137 crore between May 2-20
62.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹35,137 crore during May 2-20, data with depositories showed. After turning net investors for the first time in six months between April 1-8, FPIs turned net sellers again during April 11-13 week and have remained negative since then. The net outflow of FPIs from equities has reached ₹1.63 lakh crore so far in 2022.

63.title: Get Tripathi to Aus for T20 WC, he's dangerous striker of ball: Hayden
63.article_body: Ex-Australia batter Matthew Hayden has said that SRH batter Rahul Tripathi is a dangerous striker of the ball. "You get him to Australia (for the T20 WC 2022) because he can play those brilliant shots on the bouncy pitches there," Hayden added. In the IPL 2022, Tripathi has scored 393 in 13 matches so far at an average of 39.30.

64.title: PM Modi, US Prez Biden to have discussion on Ukraine situation on May 24
64.article_body: PM Narendra Modi and US President Joe Biden, during a bilateral meeting in Tokyo on May 24 (Tuesday), will have a constructive and straightforward dialogue along with a continued discussion on the Ukraine situation. US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said, "It'll be a continuation of the conversation they have already had on how we see the picture in Ukraine."

65.title: Got acting coach for 'Jugjugg Jeeyo', acting different now: Neetu
65.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor stated that she hired an acting coach for 'Jugjugg Jeeyo' and took acting and diction classes. "When I was working earlier in the '70s and '80s, our acting was very animated and loud. Today, it has become subtle," the actress added. She further said it helped her get out of depression after her husband Rishi Kapoor's demise.

66.title: Israel reports 1st monkeypox case, asks foreign returnees to get tested
66.article_body: Israel has detected its first monkeypox case in a man who returned from abroad, authorities have confirmed. The country's health ministry said the man has been admitted to a hospital in Tel Aviv and is stable, additionally asking foreign returnees with fever and lesions to visit a doctor. Monkeypox cases have been reported in US, Portugal, UK, among other countries.

67.title: T Natarajan has lost some rhythm since returning from injury: Aakash
67.article_body: Ex-India batter Aakash Chopra has said that SRH pacer T Natarajan lost "some rhythm" after returning from injury. In the match against Mumbai Indians on Tuesday, Natarajan conceded 60 runs in his four-over bowling spell. Speaking about his performance versus MI, Aakash said, "He struggled to get his yorkers right. He was trying, but it was...not coming out right."

68.title: Video shows man standing on two moving SUVs in Noida; arrested
68.article_body: A 21-year-old man has been arrested for performing dangerous stunts on vehicles and bikes in Sector-113 in Noida. A video posted by the Uttar Pradesh Police shows the man standing on two moving SUVs on a city road. Police have also seized the two SUVs and a motorcycle used by him in stunts.

69.title: Shared a room with my cook when I moved to Mumbai: Ayushmann
69.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has revealed in an interview that when he moved to Mumbai, he shared a room with his cook. He said that he brought his cook with him because he can't live without food. "He didn't have any place to stay so I was like you stay in my room but I need a cook," the actor added.

70.title: Maharashtra cuts VAT on petrol by ₹2.08 per litre, diesel by ₹1.44 per litre
70.article_body: The Maharashtra government on Sunday announced a VAT reduction of ₹2.08 per litre on petrol and ₹1.44 per litre on diesel with immediate effect. This comes after the Centre on Saturday announced reduction in central excise duty on petrol by ₹8 per litre and diesel by ₹6 per litre in order to ease inflation.

71.title: There's no competition: Karan on South films doing better than Hindi
71.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, on being asked about South Indian films performing better at the box office than Hindi films, said that there is no competition and it's about growing together. "We have to be one collective unit, one cinema," he added. The filmmaker further said that Hindi films are getting back on track with 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

72.title: Quad to discuss progress of initiatives, issues of mutual interest: PM
72.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said on Sunday that the Quad Leaders Summit in Tokyo will review the progress of initiatives undertaken by the group. "We'll...exchange views about developments in...Indo-Pacific region and global issues of mutual interest,” he added. PM Modi, who will attend summit in Tokyo on May 24, will also hold bilateral meetings with leaders of US, Australia and Japan.

73.title: Arjun Singh, former West Bengal BJP Vice-President, rejoins TMC after 3 years
73.article_body: BJP Lok Sabha MP Arjun Singh on Sunday joined the Trinamool Congress after quitting the BJP. Singh, who was the West Bengal BJP's Vice-President, had left the TMC and joined BJP in 2019 ahead of the Lok Sabha election. He joined TMC in the presence of the party's General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee in Kolkata.

74.title: India squad for fifth rescheduled Test against England announced, Pujara recalled
74.article_body: The BCCI today announced a 17-member Team India squad for the fifth rescheduled Test against England. Cheteshwar Pujara has been recalled to the squad after having been dropped for the home Test series against Sri Lanka. The squad also includes Prasidh Krishna, KS Bharat, Mohammed Siraj and Umesh Yadav. The Test will take place from July 1 in Edgbaston.

75.title: Businessman Sunil Chopra elected Mayor of London borough for 2nd time
75.article_body: Delhi-born businessman Sunil Chopra has been elected as the Mayor of the Borough of Southwark in the UK's London for the second time. Chopra became the first Indian-origin person to hold the Mayor's office in Southwark in 2014 when he was elected there for the first time. He also held the office of Southwark's Deputy Mayor from 2013 to 2014.

76.title: 8,640 bottles of banned cough syrup seized in Thane, 2 arrested
76.article_body: Over 8,640 bottles of cough syrup with the banned narcotic drug codeine have been seized from Maharashtra's Thane district, officials said on Sunday. The Narcotics Control Bureau has arrested two persons in this connection. The bottles, collectively weighing 864 kg, were kept in 60 boxes in their car.

77.title: Team India squad for T20I series against South Africa announced; Rohit, Kohli rested
77.article_body: India squad for the five-match T20I series against South Africa has been announced. Captain Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah have been rested, while KL Rahul has been appointed the captain for the series. Dinesh Karthik and Hardik Pandya return to the squad, while SRH pacer Umran Malik and PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh have been given a maiden call-up.

78.title: Pune RTO to soon conduct drive against illegally modified e-bikes
78.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office (RTO) will soon conduct a drive to check the use of illegally modified e-bikes, officials said. E-bikes with battery capacity of less than 250 watts and speed limit of 25 km/hour are exempted from registration. "It's found that some manufacturers are...later increasing the battery capacity and [the bike's range]," said Pune Regional Transport Officer Ajit Shinde.

79.title: This is how the Britishers came and divided us: Akshay Kumar on north-south cinema debate
79.article_body: Reacting to the north-south cinema debate, Akshay Kumar said, "I think we should stop asking this question." Adding that "we are all a common industry", Akshay said, "It's important that we understand...this is how the Britishers came and divided us, they invaded us and ruled us. We don’t seem to have learnt our lesson, we are still not understanding this."

80.title: Sitharaman compares development spendings before & after 2014 after fuel price cut
80.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman clarified that the burden of recent petrol and diesel price cut will be borne by the Centre and compared developmental expenditure incurred by governments before and after 2014. "Expenditure incurred by the [Narendra Modi-led] govt during 2014-22 was ₹90.9 lakh crore...Only ₹49.2 lakh crore was spent on developmental expenditure during 2004-14," she stated.

81.title: I never compromised: Kangana on not doing item songs, endorsing fairness creams
81.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said she never did any item song or endorsed fairness creams even when she started her career. "I never did anything because of which I've to compromise now," she added. "Even when you look at my history, you'll never find anything controversial...I started taking a stand when I felt that I'm at a certain level," Kangana said.

82.title: Woman caught me at a Pune premiere for 2-3 minutes, I was stuck there: Bobby
82.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol, while recalling a moment with a female fan at a premiere in Pune, said that she "caught" him and didn't let go for two-three minutes. "I was like...how do I get out of here...I was stuck. I couldn't even push her, I didn't know what to do," Bobby said, adding that he understands the excitement of fans.

83.title: Govt launches single national portal for biotech startups
83.article_body: MoS for Science Jitendra Singh on Saturday launched a single national portal for India's biotech startups and researchers. The portal, Biological Research Regulatory Approval Portal (BioRRAP), will serve as a single window clearance for those seeking regulatory approval for biological research and development. Singh said India will be among the top 5 global bio-manufacturing hubs by 2025.

84.title: Actors have PR machinery to scream their achievements; I don't have it: Abhay
84.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol said all actors have "PR machinery" and it's a "marketing thing". "Actors have PR machinery. I didn't back then and I still don't. It's become...part of the job profile to have media behind you," he added. "It's like you have to scream your achievements out to people and I've always been shy of that," Abhay said.

85.title: Wicket was slow, had low bounce: Bumrah on Wankhede pitch
85.article_body: After beating DC by 5 wickets in their last game of IPL 2022 on Saturday, MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah has said that the pitch at the Wankhede Stadium was "slow". "The wicket is quite fast here, there's pace and bounce. But this (today's pitch) was slow, and the bounce was low. There wasn't much swing," Bumrah said.

86.title: Govt didn't inform before hiking fuel taxes, now asking states to cut them: TN minister
86.article_body: Tamil Nadu Finance Minister Dr P Thiaga Rajan took to Twitter after the Centre reduced excise duty on petrol and diesel. Rajan wrote, "The Union Government didn't inform, let alone ask for any state's view when they increased Union taxes on petrol...and...diesel...Now, after rolling back approximately 50% of their increases, they're exhorting states to cut."

87.title: 6-yr-old Punjab boy falls into 100-ft-deep borewell, rescue ops on
87.article_body: A six-year-old boy fell into a 100-feet-deep borewell in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Sunday, officials said, adding that a rescue operation is underway. He was playing in a field when some stray dogs started chasing him. He climbed the borewell shaft that was covered with a jute bag, but it could not withstand the weight of the boy.

88.title: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan hugs fan at Cannes, video goes viral
88.article_body: A video going viral on social media shows a fan of actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan hugging her at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival. Another fan can be heard saying, "So lucky," as Aishwarya returns the hug. Aishwarya tells her fans, "God bless and take care." A social media user commented, "Most humble actress," while another wrote, "Love her attitude."

89.title: Sun Pharma recalls 10,548 bottles of anti-depression drug in US
89.article_body: India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharma is recalling 10,548 bottles of bupropion hydrochloride extended-release tablets, a generic anti-depression drug, in the US market. As per the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA), a customer found a "dark, gritty substance" inside one bottle. The affected lot of the medication was manufactured by Sun Pharma in its manufacturing plant in Gujarat's Halol.

90.title: Wearing burqa isn't Afghan tradition: Ex-Prez on Taliban's new decree
90.article_body: Reacting to the Taliban's recent decree demanding Afghan women to fully cover themselves in public spaces, ex-President Hamid Karzai said that wearing the burqa isn't an Afghan tradition. He added that the use of the burqa came to the country 200-300 years ago. Karzai also condemned the Taliban's decision to keep high schools closed to girls, calling the move "unfortunate".

91.title: Lataji performed barefoot at London's Royal Albert Hall: Javed Ali
91.article_body: Singer Javed Ali has revealed that late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar came on stage barefoot at London's Royal Albert Hall. He added that late veteran actor Dilip Kumar introduced her and, when she came without slippers, asked her to wear them. "Lataji refused and said, 'I never sing a song wearing slippers as for me it's a prayer'," Javed said.

92.title: Jeremy Renner to star in biopic about US opioid epidemic
92.article_body: Jeremy Renner, known for playing Hawkeye in Marvel Cinematic Universe, has signed on to play the role of Pulitzer-winning investigative reporter David Armstrong, who helped expose the Sackler family's links to the US opioid epidemic. The project will be penned and directed by Aron Gaudet and Gita Pullapilly. More than 450,000 Americans died from opioid use from 1999 to 2016.

93.title: Didn't want to say 'we're just friends': Rakul on her relationship with Jackky
93.article_body: Speaking about her relationship with her boyfriend, producer Jackky Bhagnani, actress Rakul Preet Singh said, "We don't want to hide and say 'we're just good friends'." "We want to acknowledge that. But do I want it to be a talking point? The answer is no...My work should speak. Both of us are on our own individual journeys," she added.

94.title: Rahul Baba must take out his Italian specs: Amit Shah
94.article_body: Criticising Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his recent remarks on the BJP-ruled Centre, Union Home Minister Amit Shah has said that "Rahul baba must take out his Italian specs". "He (Rahul) must have a look at the development work done by PM Modi & CM Pema Khandu," said Shah while laying the foundation stone of various projects in Arunachal Pradesh.

95.title: UP govt schools to get loudspeakers removed from religious places
95.article_body: According to Uttar Pradesh district officials, loudspeakers that have been removed from religious places in the state are being given to government schools. Schools can use loudspeakers for educational purposes, Gorakhpur DM Vijay Kiran Anand said. Lucknow DM Abhishek Prakash said that while Gorakhpur has started the distribution, the state capital will begin the process next week.

96.title: Was born in India: TMC's Alo Rani Sarkar on being ruled B'deshi national
96.article_body: Trinamool Congress' Alo Rani Sarkar said on Saturday that she was born in India in 1969. She added that her family permanently moved to the country in 1971, further stating that she has ancestral property in Bangladesh. Her remarks come after Calcutta HC ruled her Bangladeshi while dismissing her petition challenging verdict of her constituency's result in Bengal Assembly polls.

97.title: Don't want to leave space uncontested for BJP: Mehbooba Mufti
97.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said her party will contest the upcoming J&K panchayat elections as she "does not want to leave any space uncontested for BJP". I am not going to be in power politics for quite sometime now, Mufti said. "To thwart [BJP's] designs, if [political parties] have to come together and fight elections unitedly, why not?" she added.

98.title: Day 3 of AMU Lit Fest cancelled, students protest against admin decision
98.article_body: On Sunday, the Aligarh Muslim University's administration cancelled day 3 events of the AMU Literature Festival 2022. The event was temporarily cancelled on Saturday but later resumed, students said. However, an AMU professor told the Quint that the fest had been cancelled due to "logistical reasons". Notably, the three-day fest is organised by AMU's University Debating and Literary Club.

99.title: Aligarh Police warn residents against provocative social media comments
99.article_body: The Aligarh Police have warned the residents against posting provocative and communally sensitive comments on social media. "Careless approach on the part of an individual while posting irresponsible comments on social media might land him or her behind the bars. The Aligarh Police are keeping a close vigil on those indulging in such activities," Kalanidhi Naithani, SSP, said.

100.title: Illegal B'luru hookah bar raided; cash, items worth ₹50,000 seized
100.article_body: Joint Commissioner of Police, Raman Gupta, took to Twitter to share that the CCB Anti Narcotics squad raided a hookah bar in Bengaluru. He mentioned in his tweet that two people who were operating the bar illegally have been apprehended. The tweet further said that hookah packets, flavours, cash and other items worth ₹50,000 were seized during the raid.

101.title: Not fair that South films are doing well & we're like 'okay this is also us': Aditi
101.article_body: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari has said that people are realising films from South India are part of the Indian film industry after several big successes, adding, "We should have done it earlier." She said, "It is not fair that they are doing well and suddenly we are like 'okay this is also us.' We need to be more inclusive."

102.title: Everybody should be concerned about monkeypox: US Prez after cases in 12 countries
102.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Sunday said that everybody should be concerned about the monkeypox outbreak. He added, "We're working on it hard to figure out what we do and what vaccine, if any, may be available for it." This comes after the WHO confirmed 92 monkeypox cases across 12 countries that are not endemic for monkeypox virus.

103.title: Entire burden of excise duty cuts on petrol, diesel is borne by Centre: FM
103.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday tweeted that the entire burden of the duty cuts on petrol and diesel announced yesterday and in November 2021 is being borne by the Centre. "Excise duty reduction...has entirely been made in Road & Infrastructure Cess," Sitharaman explained, adding that the Basic Excise Duty, which is sharable with the states, has not been touched.

104.title: Hello...Period: Biden in message for Kim during his 1st Asia visit as US Prez
104.article_body: US President Joe Biden when asked in South Korea's Seoul what message he had for North Korea's Kim Jong-un, said, "Hello...period." Referring to North Korean nuclear weapons tests, Biden said, "We are prepared for anything North Korea does. I'm not concerned." Biden is on his first visit to Asia as the US President.

105.title: Veteran playback singer Sangeetha Sajith passes away at 46
105.article_body: Veteran South Indian playback singer Sangeetha Sajith passed away on Sunday morning at the age of 46. She was reportedly suffering from kidney-related ailments. She died at her sister's residence in Thiruvananthapuram. Sangeetha has sung over 200 film songs in various South Indian languages, including Malayalam, Tamil, Telugu and Kannada.

106.title: They are going to have sleepless nights: Shastri on Pant not taking DRS against Tim David
106.article_body: Talking about DC captain Rishabh Pant opting not to take DRS against MI's Tim David after a caught behind appeal, Ravi Shastri said that Pant should've taken the review as it was a "no-brainer". Shastri added DC players are going to have sleepless nights over this. David, who could've been dismissed for 0(1), scored 34(11) to help MI win.

107.title: How did CSK finish on IPL points table over the years?
107.article_body: CSK managed to win just four matches in IPL 2022, finishing ninth on the points table, their worst performance in an IPL season. CSK's previous worst performance had come in IPL 2020, when they finished seventh with six victories. CSK have recorded a top-two finish on IPL points table in seven of their 13 seasons.

108.title: Was forced to act in 'Naane...' as an actor didn't turn up: Maker Selvaraghavan
108.article_body: 'Naane Varuven' director Selvaraghavan has revealed that he was "forced" to act in the film. "It was not my intention," he added. "Last minute the actor didn't turn up...there was no one for the role and it is a very important character. There was no pre-planning," Selvaraghavan said. The upcoming film also stars his actor-brother Dhanush.

109.title: Israeli forces kill 17-yr-old Palestinian militant during clashes
109.article_body: Israeli forces shot dead a 17-year-old Palestinian militant on Saturday during clashes in West Bank, according to the Palestinian Health Ministry and local media. The Israeli military said that its soldiers had opened fire after gunmen shot at them from a passing vehicle and threw explosives. Meanwhile, Palestinian Islamic Jihad said that the deceased teenager was one of its members.

110.title: Deadly gas, don't light match: Note at Delhi flat after woman, 2 daughters are found dead
110.article_body: Delhi Police have recovered a warning note from the flat where a 54-year-old woman and her two daughters, aged 27 and 25, were found dead due to suspected suicide. "Too much deadly gas...carbon monoxide inside...Do not light match, candle...Do not inhale," the warning note read. Police said the family had been depressed since the woman's husband died last year.

111.title: Worked really hard on my shape: MI's Tim David
111.article_body: After scoring a match-winning 34(11) against Delhi Capitals on Saturday, Mumbai Indians batter Tim David revealed that he has worked hard on his "shape". "Early in the season I was leaning back on the ball...so I've worked really hard on my shape," David said. "Had to hold my shape...got lucky with a couple of baby sixes," the Singaporean cricketer said.

112.title: Who is Ankiti Bose, the Indian-origin Co-founder of Zilingo who was fired as CEO?
112.article_body: Ankiti Bose is the Indian-origin Co-founder of Singapore-based Zilingo who started the B2B e-commerce startup after visiting Bangkok's Chatuchak Market, one of the world's largest weekend markets. Founded in 2015, Zilingo was valued at nearly $1 billion in 2019, when Bose was 27 years old. Bose has featured on Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia and Fortune 40 Under 40 list.

113.title: She can pull any kind of look: Deepika's makeup artist on her Cannes looks
113.article_body: French makeup and hair expert Florian Hurel, who has worked with the actress Deepika Padukone, spoke about her Cannes 2022 looks. She said, "Deepika is one such actress who is always ready to experiment with her looks...She can pull any kind of look." "You have to be very confident to carry such a look! Hats off to her!" Florian added.

114.title: Some planned to lay down a trap: MNS chief on cancelling Ayodhya trip
114.article_body: After cancelling his visit to Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray said, "Those who were rattled by my announcement to visit Ayodhya were planning to lay down a trap." Addressing a rally in Pune, he added that many people did not like his decision to put the plan on hold.

115.title: 57 pilgrims died since onset of Char Dham Yatra 2022
115.article_body: As many as 57 pilgrims have died since the Char Dham Yatra 2022 began on May 3, DG Health, Dr Shailja Bhatt, said on Sunday. "Health screening of pilgrims is being done on Yatra travel routes," Bhatt added. Earlier, the state government mandated registration for the Char Dham Yatra pilgrims before commencing their journey.

116.title: Expert panel led by IIT prof to probe Ramban tunnel collapse
116.article_body: The Centre has constituted a three-member committee, led by IIT Delhi's Professor JT Shahu, to probe the tunnel collapse incident in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban which killed 10 labourers on Thursday, a government order said. The panel carried out an inspection of the site on Saturday and Sunday and has been asked to submit a detailed report within 10 days.

117.title: Hina unveils poster of 'Country of Blind' at Cannes India Pavilion
117.article_body: Actress Hina Khan unveiled the poster of her second film 'Country of Blind' at the India Pavilion of the 2022 Cannes Film Festival. The film is based on HG Wells' novel of the same name and is directed by Rahat Kazmi. This is Hina's second film poster to be released at the Cannes Film Festival after her debut film 'Lines'.

118.title: We weren't consistent, lost key moments: PBKS head coach Anil Kumble
118.article_body: Punjab Kings head coach Anil Kumble, speaking about his team's IPL 2022 campaign, has said, "The team wasn't consistent." He added, "We...need to find a way to bring better consistency in the coming seasons." PBKS did not qualify for the IPL 2022 playoffs. "We lost key moments...There are a lot of positives, but...disappointed that we couldn't make it," he added.

119.title: Croatian police open fire during clash with soccer fans; many hurt
119.article_body: Croatian police on Saturday opened fire with live ammunition during clashes with soccer fans, who were returning from a match in Zagreb after their team lost, authorities said. The incident occurred when the fans who were travelling in buses under police escort allegedly attacked police officers when the vehicles stopped. Two fans and about a dozen police officers were injured.

120.title: Will consider further cut: K'taka CM after Centre reduces fuel prices
120.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday said the state government "will consider" further cut in fuel tax. His statement comes after the Centre on Saturday announced a ₹8 per litre cut in excise duty on petrol and ₹6 per litre on diesel. "I thank honourable PM Narendra Modi...This is a pro-people decision," Bommai had tweeted following the announcement.

121.title: Ukrainian director criticises Cannes for screening Russian film
121.article_body: Ukrainian director Dmytro Sukholytkyy-Sobchuk has criticised the 2022 Cannes Film Festival for including a Russian director in its line-up. While the official Russian delegations were banned from attending, director Kirill Serebrennikov's in-competition film was premiered at Cannes on Wednesday. "When he's here, he is part of the Russian propaganda and they can use him," Sukholytkyy-Sobchuk said.

122.title: Some players take time to understand because it's a new team: Rohit
122.article_body: After finishing their campaign at IPL 2022 with just four wins, Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit Sharma has said that some players will "take time" to understand their role because it is a "new team". "This season has been disappointing for us because we could not get a lot of things right during the first half," Sharma said.

123.title: Initially Milind bagged the part of Shekhar in 'Jo Jeeta Wohi...': Deepak Tijori
123.article_body: Actor Deepak Tijori revealed that initially, he wasn't a part of 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar'. "Milind Soman had bagged the part. 75% of the film was shot with him," he said. "Then the makers scrapped the film. It was shut for some time. I knew they had shot it as I had auditioned and I was not selected," he added.

124.title: Raj Thackeray asks PM to change Aurangabad's name to Sambhajinagar
124.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Sunday requested PM Narendra Modi to change the name of Aurangabad to Sambhajinagar. "I request the Prime Minister to bring Uniform Civil Code at the earliest, also bring a law on population control," Thackeray added while addressing a rally in Pune. The Pune Police have imposed several conditions for Thackeray's public rally.

125.title: Depp's lawyer laughs on being asked if she's dating him, video viral
125.article_body: A video showing Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez laughing as a photographer asks her outside the courtroom if she is dating the actor has gone viral online. The photographer can be seen asking her, "Yes or no?" but Camille ignores the question and keeps walking. She also pauses to pet a fan's dog and hugs other fans before moving away.

126.title: Grateful for all the love: Aanand on 7 yrs of 'Tanu weds Manu Returns'
126.article_body: As his film 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' completed seven years of its release on Sunday, director Aanand L Rai said, "It's great to see that 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' has amazing re-watch value." "I'm humbled and grateful for all the love that this film has continued to receive," he added. 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' starred R Madhavan and Kangana Ranaut.

127.title: Foreign national held for cyber fraud in B'luru, 5 fake SIM cards seized
127.article_body: Deputy Commissioner of Police, Anoop A Shetty, took to Twitter to share that the Bengaluru Police have arrested a foreign national who was involved in a cyber fraud using fake SIM cards and bank accounts. The police officer also mentioned in his tweet that five fake SIM cards have been seized from the accused.

128.title: Govt denies reports of ordering ASI to conduct excavation at Qutub Minar complex
128.article_body: After reports claimed that the Ministry of Culture has instructed Archaeological Survey of India to conduct excavation at Qutub Minar, Union Minister G Kishan Reddy said, "No such decision has been taken." This comes after ASI's ex-regional director Dharamveer Sharma claimed that idols of Hindu deities were found in the monument's complex and that it was built by Raja Vikramaditya.

129.title: Major fire breaks out at pharma company in Guj, 10 fire tenders rushed to spot
129.article_body: A major fire broke out in a pharma company in Gujarat's Gandhinagar district on Sunday. Five fire tenders were rushed to the spot after a call about the incident was received at 9 am. "More than five other fire tenders from...Ahmedabad, Gandhinagar, Kalol and Kadi...were also sent," Gandhinagar fire station officer said. Officials said no casualties were reported in incident.

130.title: 400-yr-old public bath found near 'Bibi Ka Maqbara' in Aurangabad, pic surfaces
130.article_body: Remnants of a 400-year-old hammam (public bath) have been found near the 'Bibi Ka Maqbara' (the Taj Mahal's replica) in Maharashtra's Aurangabad. The hammam is located near the entrance of the tomb built by Mughal ruler Aurangzeb in the memory of his first wife Dilras Banu Begum. It might've been meant for use before entering the tomb, ASI officials said.

131.title: Captaincy isn't everyone's cup of tea: Piyush Chawla on Mayank Agarwal
131.article_body: Piyush Chawla has opined that the pressure of leading Punjab Kings was "visible" in Mayank Agarwal's batting in IPL 2022. "The pressure of captaincy is different...it was clearly visible in his batting as well as how he used to look a bit edgy on the field," he said. "Captaincy isn't everyone's cup of tea...it showed clearly here," he added.

132.title: Ashamed this is happening in my country: Kapil Sibal on Neemuch killing
132.article_body: Congress leader Kapil Sibal condemned the killing of a mentally unstable man in Madhya Pradesh’s Neemuch. One man has been arrested for thrashing him to death. "Differently-abled elderly man beaten to death on suspicion of being a Muslim. I am ashamed that this is happening in my country," Sibal tweeted on Sunday.

133.title: IPL betting racket busted in Delhi; 6 arrested, ₹74,740 seized
133.article_body: Delhi Police busted an IPL betting racket operating in Delhi's Nihal Vihar and arrested six persons engaged in it. Police recovered ₹74,740 in cash, 10 mobile phones, two laptops, three internet routers, two LED TVs and other devices from the spot. We acted on a specific input, received by special staff on May 15, to conduct the raid, police said.

134.title: 'Welcome' started off as love story, became comedy during writing: Maker Anees
134.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee, writer and director of Akshay Kumar-starrer film 'Welcome', revealed that the film "started off as a love story back in the day". "But as the writing progressed, it turned out to be a comedy. The story lent itself to all those quirky characters," he added. 'Welcome' also featured Katrina Kaif, Nana Patekar and Anil Kapoor, among others.

135.title: Road widening work on old Mumbai-Pune highway begins
135.article_body: The road widening work on the old Mumbai-Pune highway in Khadki has begun. The work was stalled for several years and now the Department of Defence has given the approval to hand over the two kilometres of land required for the project. The 42-metre wide road is expected to decongest the area.

136.title: Russians to be absent from WEF in Davos for first time since fall of communism
136.article_body: Russian oligarchs and companies will be absent from the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos this year amid the invasion of Ukraine. This will mark the first time since the fall of communism that the WEF will be held without Russian officials or business leaders, Bloomberg reported. The WEF will be held in-person for the first time in two years.

137.title: Stopped 11 child marriages, caught 73 eve-teasers in 2 months: Hyd Police
137.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police said on Saturday that they had averted at least 11 child marriages and apprehended as many as 73 eve-teasers over the last eight weeks. Police further said that the eve-teasers, along with their family members, had received counselling from the authorities. Additionally, police shared a WhatsApp number for people to contact and report eve-teasing cases.

138.title: NCLAT rejects Hinduja Leyland Finance's insolvency plea against Fly Express
138.article_body: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has dismissed the plea of Hinduja Leyland Finance Ltd to initiate insolvency proceedings against its creditor Fly Express Logistics. This comes after the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) rejected the plea in April, saying the date of default, December 24, 2022, falls within prohibition period mentioned in the Insolvency & Bankruptcy Code.

139.title: US Air Force Academy to not commission 3 cadets who refused COVID vaccine
139.article_body: Three US Air Force Academy cadets who refused the COVID-19 vaccine will graduate, but won't be commissioned, the institute's spokesperson said on Saturday. US Air Force Secretary will take the decision on whether the cadets will reimburse the educational costs in lieu of service, the spokesperson added. A fourth cadet has got vaccinated after refusing previously, the spokesperson further said.

140.title: Can't compete with giraffes around me: Aditi on her Cannes red carpet debut
140.article_body: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari recently walked the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival 2022, which marked her first appearance at the festival. Aditi said that she's a tiny person who feels comfortable in her body and how she presents herself. "I'm a tiny person...I cannot compete with...the giraffes around me...So I've to be comfortable with who I'm," she added.

141.title: Arrest all policemen involved immediately: Activists on Hyd encounter
141.article_body: Reacting to the SC-appointed panel's findings on 2019 Hyderabad encounter, Telangana Women and Transgender Organisations Joint Action Committee (TWTOJAC) said that all policemen involved should be immediately arrested. TWTOJAC has also sought compensation for families of those killed. The panel found that police staged encounter to kill four persons accused of raping and murdering a veterinarian.

142.title: I stand corrected: Chidambaram on tweets criticising govt after fuel price cut
142.article_body: Congress' P Chidambaram has said the facts of Centre's fuel price reduction are contrary to what he had previously claimed, adding, "I stand corrected." "Entire burden of the reduction falls on the Centre," he admitted. He had earlier said the Finance Minister's exhortation to states is meaningless as 41 paise of a rupee in "central excise" belong to the states.

143.title: You don't discriminate between medallists, non-medallists: 14-yr-old shuttler to PM
143.article_body: During an interaction with PM Narendra Modi, 14-year-old shuttler Unnati Hooda told him, "What motivates me the most is that you never discriminate between medallists and non-medallists." She added, "I have learned a lot in this tournament (Uber Cup). Next time, the women's team also has to win." PM also interacted with the men's badminton team that won Thomas Cup.

144.title: Heard's 'Aquaman 2' role reduced over 'lack of chemistry': Agent
144.article_body: Amber Heard's agent Jessica Kovacevic has testified in the ongoing defamation trial against the actress, saying that her role in 'Aquaman 2' was reduced over her "lack of chemistry" with Jason Momoa. Kovacevic further stated that Heard also lost a role with Amazon due to bad press. Heard is being sued by ex-husband Johnny Depp over her 2018 op-ed article.

145.title: 4 relatives of wife including 1 minor held after man's murder in Hyd
145.article_body: A day after 20-year-old Neeraj Panwar was killed in Begum Bazar in Hyderabad, police have arrested four relatives of his wife, including one minor. The relatives were caught from Karnataka after running away from the city following the murder. Police said that the relatives were provoked by Neeraj's frequent visits to their locality after marrying against their wish.

146.title: Speeding car hits divider on Delhi flyover; woman dead, son injured
146.article_body: A 45-year-old woman died while her son was severely injured after their car rammed into a divider and crashed near a railing on the Satyawati flyover in Delhi's Ashok Vihar, police said. The incident took place early on Sunday morning. Probe is underway and CCTVs are being scanned to ascertain if another vehicle was involved in the accident, police added.

147.title: Bomb squad neutralises bombs found in WB's East Medinipur district
147.article_body: Bomb disposal squad on Sunday neutralised bombs that were recovered from West Bengal's East Medinipur district on Saturday. West Bengal Police said that huge quantity of bombs was recovered, after which, bomb disposal squad had rushed to the spot. News agency ANI had earlier reported that a combing operation was underway after the bombs were found.

148.title: 24-yr-old Delhi engineer goes missing in forest area near Pune
148.article_body: A 24-year-old engineer from Delhi who had visited Duke's Nose Point in Lonavala has been reported missing in a forest since Friday, police said. He had called his brother that he had lost track and later his mobile phone was switched off. Police said that the mechanical engineer had come to Kolhapur for some official work.

149.title: Recovered 3 candles, 4 suicide notes: Delhi Police after bodies of woman, daughters found
149.article_body: The bodies of a 54-year-old woman and her two daughters, aged 27 and 25, were found inside their flat in Delhi's Vasant Vihar. "Police found gas cylinder nozzle was partially opened. Four suicide notes were recovered and three small candles and an angithi were kept there," said DCP (Southwest) Manoj C. "It appears they died due to suffocation," he added.

150.title: Virat Kohli's old tweet thanking Rohit Sharma goes viral after MI send RCB to playoffs
150.article_body: After RCB qualified for IPL 2022 playoffs with the help of MI's victory against DC, an old tweet of Virat Kohli thanking Rohit Sharma went viral. The original tweet was posted by Kohli after Rohit had wished him on his birthday in 2019. On Saturday, Kohli also tweeted a handshake emoji, tagging Mumbai Indians.

151.title: Chulbul Pandey's wish came true: Salman on govt's police initiative
151.article_body: Actor Salman Khan on Saturday took to Twitter to commend the Central Government's new training programme to make the police force across the country more people-friendly and better the image of police personnel. "Ab Chulbul Pandey Ki Aasha Sach hui (Now Chulbul Pandey's wish has come true)," the actor wrote referencing his character from the 'Dabangg' film series.

152.title: Rahul is India's most unsuccessful, frustrated politician: MP CM
152.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is "India's most unsuccessful, frustrated and despondent politician". "No politicians make comments against the country as Rahul Gandhi does on foreign land," Chouhan said after Gandhi on Saturday said India is not in a "good place" at the 'Ideas for India' conclave in London.

153.title: TN to install cloth bag vending machines in public places, IAS officer shares video
153.article_body: Tamil Nadu government plans to install cloth bag vending machines in public places. IAS officer Supriya Sahu shared a demonstration video of the machine wherein she inserted a ₹10 coin in the machine which then dispensed a medium-sized cloth bag. It is being called a Manjapai Vending Machine as manjapai is a multipurpose bag widely used in the state.

154.title: Ricky shares video from B'luru airport at 3.30 am, says 'Pathetic state of immigration'
154.article_body: Two-time Grammy-winner Indian music composer Ricky Kej criticised the immigration process at Bengaluru International Airport. Sharing a video at 3.30 am, he tweeted, "Pathetic state of immigration...Been in line for over an hour now. Currently well over 1,000 people waiting, not all counters working, staff is clueless, inefficient. Why have so many flights, when there is no capacity? @kiranshaw."

155.title: Who is Gama Pehlwan, the undefeated wrestling champion honoured by Google?
155.article_body: Google Doodle on Sunday marked the 144th birth anniversary of Gama Pehlwan, the Amritsar-born wrestler who remained undefeated throughout his international matches and earned the name 'The Great Gama'. The wrestler saved the lives of many people during the Partition of India in 1947. Notably, Bruce Lee was a known admirer of Gama and incorporated aspects of his training routine.

156.title: Benedict to team up with Paul Greengrass for period drama 'The Hood'
156.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch and British filmmaker Paul Greengrass are teaming up for a period drama, 'The Hood'. According to reports, 'The Hood' is believed to be about a peasant uprising in England, and it will follow a farmer, played by Benedict, who becomes the rebellion's commander. Paul is known for directing films like 'The Bourne Supremacy' and '22 July'.

157.title: Punjab CM flags off cycle rally in Sangrur against drug menace
157.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Sunday flagged off a bicycle rally in Sangrur district as part of a campaign against drug menace in the state. "More than 15,000 youth joined the rally...it gives us courage. Your government will not stop till drugs are eradicated," CM Mann tweeted. The enthusiasm of the youth was evident in the bicycle rally, Mann added.

158.title: Calling any actress an item girl is unaesthetic; doesn't sound good: Helen
158.article_body: When asked about her views on item numbers, actress Helen said giving solo dances such a term is "derogatory". "I feel calling any song or actress an item number or item girl is...unaesthetic. It doesn't sound good," she added. "Everyone is a working professional...we shouldn't use the word 'item' to refer to an actress or to any song," she said.

159.title: China increases discounted Russian oil purchases by nearly 50%: Report
159.article_body: China is increasing its purchases of discounted Russian oil, as per shipping data and oil traders. While China had initially refused oil contracts with Russia due to the Ukraine war, it is projected to import 1.1 million barrels per day in May, about 47% up from 750,000 bpd in the first quarter, according to data accessed by Reuters.

160.title: We shouldn't bifurcate: Pooja Hegde on B'wood vs South debate
160.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde, speaking about the ongoing debate on Hindi vs South film industry, said, "We all belong to...same country, it's Indian cinema." She added that people should "stop bifurcating in terms of language". "If [we] get over the subtitle part of watching a film, we'll be open to such...amazing content. It'll make us understand...genuine culture in India," said Pooja.

161.title: We'll never know if these suspects were those who raped and killed Disha: Lawyer
161.article_body: Vrinda Grover, the counsel for the petitioners who asked for a probe into Hyderabad's Disha rape and murder case, said, "We'll never know whether these four suspects were those who raped and murdered the 26-year-old in 2019." This comes after the Supreme Court-appointed panel said that the four accused were deliberately fired upon with an intent to cause their death.

162.title: Administration demolishes 5 houses after police station set on fire in Assam
162.article_body: Houses of five families who were allegedly involved in setting a police station ablaze have been demolished by the Nagaon administration. The police station was set on fire on Saturday over a man's custodial death. The deceased's family claimed that police had demanded a bribe of ₹10,000 and a duck for his release.

163.title: RR's flight faces turbulence, franchise shares video with 'Land Kara De' meme reference
163.article_body: A flight carrying Rajasthan Royals (RR) contingent to Kolkata for their Qualifier 1 match against Gujarat Titans (GT) faced turbulence due to bad weather. "What an experience this flight was, @imjitumoni almost saw god," Riyan Parag wrote on Instagram sharing a picture. RR also shared a video of their journey with 'Land Kara De' meme reference.

164.title: Police knew 2 accused were 15 before shooting them: SC panel on Hyd rape & murder case
164.article_body: The Supreme Court-appointed panel that submitted its findings into the 2019 extra-judicial killings of four people accused in the rape and murder of a Hyderabad veterinarian said that policemen knew two of them were minors. Officials reportedly visited the school of two accused and found that they were both 15 years old, a few days after the rape and murder.

165.title: Laying of stones for Ram Mandir's main structure to begin from June: Trust
165.article_body: Anil Mishra, member of the Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust, said that the laying of stones for the main structure of the Ram Mandir will start from June. Reports said stone quarried in Rajasthan and Karnataka will be used to build the main structure. The stone will also be used for the sanctum sanctorum, where deity will be placed.

166.title: Faf du Plessis sent me a pic of him, Maxwell and Kohli in MI kit: David on MI-DC match
166.article_body: MI's Tim David has revealed that RCB captain Faf du Plessis sent him a message ahead of MI's IPL 2022 match against DC. "It was a picture of him, Glenn Maxwell and Virat Kohli all in MI kit. Maybe I'll have to post to Instagram later," he added. With MI's victory against DC, RCB qualified for the IPL 2022 playoffs.

167.title: PNB earns over ₹645 crore through ATM transaction charges in FY 2021-2022
167.article_body: Punjab National Bank has earned over ₹645 crore through ATM transaction charges levied on customers during the financial year 2021-22, the bank revealed while responding to an RTI. PNB also said that it collected ₹239.09 crore in the form of penalties imposed on customers who failed to maintain a minimum balance or quarterly/monthly average balance in their bank accounts.

168.title: Pune Police chief asks political outfits to hold protests peacefully
168.article_body: In an all-party meet, the Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta requested the political outfits to hold protests peacefully and ensure the law and order situation doesn't get affected in Pune. Gupta also asked the parties to carry out protests at designated spots only. The meet was called in the wake of recent clashes in Pune between cadres of various outfits.

169.title: Odisha autorickshaw driver returns passenger's gold necklace worth ₹1.6 lakh
169.article_body: A 35-year-old autorickshaw driver returned a gold necklace worth ₹1.6 lakh to a female passenger, who had accidentally left it in his vehicle a few days ago, in Odisha's Ganjam. The driver found the ornament underneath the passenger seat while cleaning his autorickshaw. After misplacing the necklace, the woman called up the driver, whom she knew before.

170.title: Fire breaks out at battery cell factory in Faridabad; 3 killed
170.article_body: Three workers were killed and one had a narrow escape after a fire broke out at a battery manufacturing factory in Faridabad on Saturday. According to a senior fire officer, the building didn't have a fire no objection certificate. "Some batteries exploded and the fire quickly spread to the entire floor. The victims died from suffocation," a police officer said.

171.title: Kids at school came to sons & said 'you're lucky she's your mom': Madhuri Dixit
171.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit said children in her sons' school used to come to them saying that they are lucky to have her as their mother. "For them...it was throwing them off...some kids coming up to them and saying, 'who's your mom...we know her name...her name is Madhuri Dixit'," she said, adding, "They were like 'But you're just our mom'."

172.title: I made an effort but Kangana was rude to me at Dhaakad screening: Payal Rohatgi
172.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant, Payal Rohatgi, attended 'Dhaakad' screening and praised Kangana Ranaut's sister, Rangoli Chandel for being sweet. She also took a veiled dig at Kangana on Instagram and said she was "sulking". When asked if she interacted with the actress there, Payal stated, "Yes, I made an effort but she was not happy to see me and was rude."

173.title: SUV collides with truck in UP's Siddharthnagar, 7 dead
173.article_body: An SUV carrying a marriage party rammed into a stationary truck near Katya village in Uttar Pradesh's Siddharthnagar on Saturday. The SUV had 11 passengers out of which four died on the spot while three died during the treatment at the hospital, police said. The deceased were aged between 16 to 35 years, police added.

174.title: Ex govt school superintendent gets 5 yrs of jail for molesting tribal girl
174.article_body: A former superintendent of a government secondary school was sentenced to 5 years of imprisonment by a sessions court for molesting a 16-year-old tribal girl in Mumbai's Palghar region. The incident took place in December 2017, when the accused (36) allegedly called the victim, who lived in the school's hostel since childhood, into his room and molested her.

175.title: India's historic Thomas Cup-winning team interacts with PM, gifts him racquet, sweets
175.article_body: India's historic Thomas Cup-winning team members interacted with PM Narendra Modi. PM Modi's social media accounts shared a video of their interaction. In the video, Kidambi Srikanth can be seen presenting PM Modi a racquet, while Lakshya Sen was seen gifting him 'bal mithai'. "The 'Yes, we can do it' attitude has become...new strength in India today," PM Modi said.

176.title: Kanika dances to Baby Doll with Gautam at post-wedding party, video surfaces
