176.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing singer Kanika Kapoor dancing to her song 'Baby Doll' with her husband Gautam Hathiramani at their post-wedding party. Kanika wore a shimmery red one-shoulder dress for the function, while Gautam was seen in a blue-coloured shirt. Kanika and Gautam tied the knot on Friday at a hotel in London.

177.title: Kartik doesn't eat & sleep during promotions: 'Bhool...' co-star Kiara
177.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani, while speaking about her 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' co-star Kartik Aaryan, said that he doesn't sleep and eat during promotions. "He is consumed by putting the film out there. His whole mind is always on release and in promotion," she added. Kiara further said she feels Kartik is a "very driven actor". The film released on May 20.

178.title: Highly unusual: WHO on monkeypox spread outside Africa with no travel links
178.article_body: After monkeypox cases were confirmed in 12 nations, the WHO has said that it was "highly unusual" to find patients with no travel links to an endemic area. Monkeypox endemic countries are: Benin, Cameroon, the Central African Republic, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Gabon, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Liberia, Nigeria, the Republic of the Congo, Sierra Leone and South Sudan.

179.title: There's no fight for Kashi, Mathura as it's all self-evident: Uma Bharti
179.article_body: There is no fight for Kashi and Mathura because it's all "self-evident", BJP's Uma Bharti said. She was referring to some sacred symbols which were reportedly found on the outer walls of Gyanvapi Mosque. "Kashi Vishwanath is among the 12 jyotirlingas...the shivling and the temple there are very special. There is no question of a fight there," Bharti added.

180.title: Will think about where I missed out in my loyalty: Azam Khan
180.article_body: SP leader Azam Khan said he will think about where he missed out in his loyalty and became a "vessel of hatred". His statement comes after he was given interim bail. On being asked why his party didn't raise concern for him, Khan added, "I was in jail for a long time, don’t know what happened politically."

181.title: 2 students practising for rowing event die as storm hits South Kolkata
181.article_body: Two out of five school students lost their lives after the boat they were travelling in overturned when a sudden storm hit South Kolkata on Saturday. The two were out practising for a rowing event. They were rescued from the water and rushed to the hospital where they were declared dead on arrival, police said.

182.title: Group beats staffer after argument over traffic jam at pump in Pune
182.article_body: A group of men allegedly beat an employee at a CNG pump in Pune's Narhe on Saturday after an argument broke out between one of the men and the latter over traffic congestion at the pump. A video of the incident has surfaced online. Earlier, the price of CNG had been hiked to ₹80 per kilogram in the district.

183.title: PM Modi among first global leaders to meet Australia's new PM in Tokyo
183.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will be among the first global leaders to meet Australia's new PM Anthony Albanese during the Quad summit that will take place in Tokyo on May 24. Albanese is expected to hold one-to-one meetings with PM Modi, US President Joe Biden and Japanese PM Fumio Kishida. PM Modi congratulated Albanese on Saturday soon after his poll victory.

184.title: Rahul lacks consistency, needs clarity in thought process: TMC leader
184.article_body: TMC leader Sukhendu Sekhar Ray said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi lacks consistency and should bring some clarity in his thought process. "A few days back he had said the regional parties lack ideology and only Congress can fight against the BJP. Today he is saying something completely different," Ray added. Gandhi should clarify which statement is true, he stated.

185.title: One arrested for thrashing mentally ill man to death in MP's Neemuch
185.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Police have arrested a man for thrashing a mentally unstable man to death in Neemuch. Police said that accused, Dinesh Kushwaha, has accepted that he is the one beating the man in the video of incident that went viral earlier. In the video, the deceased was seen being slapped while being asked if his "name is Mohammed".

186.title: How have MI fared on IPL points table over the years as they record worst finish in 2022?
186.article_body: Five-time champions MI recorded their worst performance in an IPL season in 2022 after losing 10 of their 14 matches. MI finished last on the points table in 2022. Their previous worst performance had come in 2009, when they finished seventh (second-last) after losing eight matches. MI have topped the table four times in IPL history.

187.title: Nehru left us to be with Pakistan: Assam CM on Rahul Gandhi's remarks in London
187.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has said that Assam never negotiated peace with India. He added, "With Gandhiji's support, Gopinath Bordoloi had to struggle to keep Assam with Bharat Mata since Nehru left us to be with Pakistan as per Cabinet Mission Plan." This comes after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said, "UP, Maharashtra, Assam, Tamil Nadu created a negotiated peace."

188.title: Assam prof sends emails to officials criticising state govt, CM; held
188.article_body: An associate professor of a college was arrested in Assam's Hailakandi on Saturday for allegedly sending emails criticising the state government to the Superintendent of Police and other officials in the district, a police officer said. The accused had also purportedly used unparliamentary terms against the state CM and Education Minister in the emails, a police station officer-in-charge said.

189.title: 31-yr-old man sentenced to 15 yrs jail for drugging, raping woman
189.article_body: A Mumbai special court has sentenced a 31-year-old man to 15 years of imprisonment for drugging and raping his female colleague. The accused had even allegedly recorded a video of the sexual act to extort the victim, who is married, for money amounting to ₹10,000. Notably, both of them used to work together at a hospital.

190.title: 4 dead after severe storms hit Canada; 9 lakh homes without power
190.article_body: Four people have died after severe storms hit the eastern Canadian provinces of Ontario and Quebec on Saturday, authorities said. One of the deceased was killed when a tree fell on the trailer he was staying in. According to local power suppliers Hydro One and Hydro-Quebec, nearly nine lakh homes in the two provinces were without electricity the same night.

191.title: Musk, stop horsing around & close this Twitter deal: YouTube Co-founder
191.article_body: YouTube Co-founder Chad Hurley tweeted to Tesla CEO Elon Musk, "Stop horsing around and close this Twitter deal. We all want a happy ending!" Apparently referring to the recent allegations of him offering to buy a horse for a flight attendant in exchange for an erotic massage, Musk replied, "Fine, if you touch my wiener, you can have a horse."

192.title: What is the problem, what is wrong with it: Akshay Kumar on remakes
192.article_body: Akshay Kumar in an interview said, "Someone questioned me...about remakes and why are we remaking it? I asked why not...What's the problem?" "'Oh My God!' was remade in Telugu and became a huge hit. 'Rowdy Rathore' we remade and worked for...us," he said, adding, "If a good film is being made in South and we...remake it, what's wrong in it?"

193.title: India on road to contribute 15% of world GDP by 2047: Scindia
193.article_body: India has to focus on building capability as it is on the road to providing 25% of the total global workforce and contributing 15% of global GDP by 2047, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said. "India has shown that the Indian way of globalisation will show the path for globalisation that will be balanced...and pivoted on territorial integrity," Scindia added.

194.title: Mob sets Assam police station on fire over alleged custodial death
194.article_body: A mob allegedly vandalised and set a police station on fire in Assam's Nagaon on Saturday over a man's custodial death. The deceased's family claimed that police had demanded a ₹10,000 bribe and a duck for his release. A video of the incident has surfaced online. Nagaon SP Leena Doley said that two police officers were injured in the incident.

195.title: Johar shares throwback pic with Zoya, Anurag, Dibakar from Cannes 2013
195.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar recently took to his Instagram Stories to share a throwback picture of him, Zoya Akhtar, Anurag Kashyap and Dibakar Banerjee from the 2013 Cannes Film Festival. "Cannes throwback@ 2013! #bombaytalkies," he wrote along with the picture. Karan, Zoya, Anurag and Dibakar's 'Bombay Talkies' was screened at Cannes that year.

196.title: Aayush walks out of 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi...'; cites creative differences: Reports
196.article_body: Aayush Sharma, who was set to star in Salman Khan's 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', reportedly walked out of the film. According to reports, he started shooting for his portions of film and even completed a day's worth of shooting. However, creative differences arose between him and the production house and he decided to walk out of the film, reports added.

197.title: She was always late to rehearsals, we fought like cats and dogs: Remo on wife
197.article_body: Choreographer-director Remo Dsouza said that he used to make his wife Lizelle Dsouza rehearse after she joined Ahmed Khan's dance group in their initial days of meeting each other. "She was always late, so we fought like cats and dogs...One day we realised that despite our fights, there is love between us," he added.

198.title: Owners to be fined ₹1,000 for non-registration of pet dogs in Mohali from June 1
198.article_body: The Mohali Municipal Corporation has decided to fine the owners for non-registration of their pet dogs in the city. The owners will be fined ₹1,000 from June 1. The corporation had initiated the process of registrations in November 2021. MC commissioner Kamal Kumar Garg said that teams have been formed to survey areas to identify unregistered dogs.

199.title: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly buys new mansion in Kolkata for over ₹40 crore
199.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has bought a new mansion in central Kolkata for over ₹40 crore. It is a 23.6-kottah plot with a two-storey building on Lower Rawdon Street. "I am happy to have my own home. Living in the central area will be convenient. But it’s hard to leave the home where I lived for 48 years," Ganguly said.

200.title: Mayhem Studios launches the trailer of Underworld Gang Wars
200.article_body: Mayhem Studios offered a sneak peek into its upcoming Battle Royale game Underworld Gang Wars. The brand revealed that the game revolves around the arch-rivalry between two protagonists Boris & Tyagi and their respective gangs Bhokal Toli & Velvets. With locations, plots, weapons & vehicles rooted in India, UGW brings the much-loved Battle Royale format an Indian touch, it added.

201.title: Army personnel in highly-sensitive regiment honeytrapped by Pakistani agent, arrested
201.article_body: Rajasthan Police have arrested an Indian Army personnel posted in a highly-sensitive regiment for allegedly leaking information to a female agent of Pakistani intelligence agency, said Umesh Mishra, DG (Intelligence). The Indian Army personnel was identified as Pradeep Kumar. He was in constant contact with the female agent through social media and was sharing information of strategic importance.

202.title: Oil spills on road after tanker overturns in Maha; video surfaces
202.article_body: A video has surfaced showing villagers collecting oil in cans and utensils after an edible oil tanker overturned, causing the liquid to spill on the road near Maharashtra's Dahanu. The tanker was carrying around 12,000 litres of oil. The incident occurred after the driver lost control of the tanker. The driver sustained injuries and was admitted to a health centre.

203.title: Apple may expand production in India amid tight COVID-19 norms in China: Report
203.article_body: Apple has reportedly instructed several of its contract manufacturers that it is looking to expand production outside of China amid its tight COVID-19 restrictions. According to The Wall Street Journal, India and Vietnam, that account for a minority of Apple's global production, are being considered for this. It also said Apple is speaking to existing Indian suppliers regarding the expansion.

204.title: Tejasswi is delaying it; our parents meet more than us: Karan on wedding plans
204.article_body: When asked about his wedding plans with his girlfriend, actress Tejasswi Prakash, actor Karan Kundrra said that she is delaying the marriage as she's too busy. "The funny part is that our parents meet each other more than us as they have more time," he added. "But we are going with the natural progression as of now," Karan said.

205.title: Will implement Delhi model of schools in Telangana: CM KCR
205.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao (KCR) on Saturday said that his government will implement Delhi model of schools in the state. "We will soon send a team of officers from our state to coordinate," Rao added. His statement came as he, along with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, visited a Delhi government school in the national capital on Saturday.

206.title: Several conditions imposed by police for Raj's Pune rally on Sunday
206.article_body: The Pune Police have imposed several conditions for Raj Thackeray's public rally at the Ganesh Kala Krida Manch on Sunday. Some notable conditions imposed are that the rally should be held between 10 am-2 pm, and speakers must ensure that their speech doesn't offend a particular community. Also, decibel limits of loudspeakers, as per government norms, need to be ensured.

207.title: Need help from govt: Mom of rape accused killed in 2019 Hyd encounter
207.article_body: After Supreme Court panel set up to probe killing of accused in alleged encounter after 2019 Hyderabad rape case said it does not believe police version of events, mother of one of the accused demanded help from government. She said her son won't come back and getting financial assistance from government would be of great help.

208.title: India reports 2,226 new COVID-19 cases, 65 deaths in last 24 hours
208.article_body: India has reported 2,226 COVID-19 cases, 2,202 recoveries and 65 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,323 COVID-19 cases and 25 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 14,955, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,413.

209.title: 42-yr-old Laxmi Jadhav becomes BEST buses' first-woman driver ever
209.article_body: 42-year-old Mumbai resident, Laxmi Jadhav, has become the first-woman driver ever of the city's century-old BrihanMumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) bus service. However, BEST will not be Jadhav's employer as she is an employee of a bus contractor. Jadhav, who will start working next week, will drive the bus route between the Dharavi bus depot and south Mumbai.

210.title: RCB share pics of Kohli and others dancing after MI's win against DC, post goes viral
210.article_body: RCB took to Instagram to share pictures of Virat Kohli and other players dancing after they booked a spot in IPL 2022 playoffs following MI's victory against DC. "Absolute scenes! The team had so much fun cheering for Mumbai Indians!" RCB wrote. "Emotions in the change room were unbelievable. Thank you Mumbai," Kohli said in a video shared by RCB.

211.title: How did Rohit Sharma perform in IPL 2022 as compared to other seasons?
211.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma ended his IPL 2022 campaign as statistically his worst IPL season ever. He scored 268 runs, the lowest amount of runs he has scored in any IPL season. He recorded his lowest batting average in an IPL season at 19.14. Further, this is the first time he failed to hit a fifty in an IPL season.

212.title: 1 yr of hard work & 1 Friday took it all away: Arjun on Tevar's performance
212.article_body: Arjun Kapoor, speaking about his 2015 action-drama 'Tevar', said he was "heartbroken" after the film didn't work at the box office. "It was produced by my family...I'd not signed any other film while doing [it]...because I wanted to put all my energy into it," Arjun said, adding, "So one whole year of hard work and one Friday...took it all away."

213.title: I am an electrical engineer, didn’t think of launching a makeup brand: SUGAR CEO
213.article_body: SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh took to LinkedIn to share how she launched her brand while being an electrical engineer and with no experience with makeup. "I didn’t think of launching a makeup brand…Kaushik Mukherjee [her husband] and I started something else and it failed and it was our customers who literally took us down this road," she said.

214.title: India can be world's 4th largest economy by 2047: Scindia
214.article_body: India can become the world's fourth largest economy by 2047, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Saturday. "By the year 2047, there will be full saturation of all the government schemes and a per capita income of ₹53,000 in 2010-11, will reach above ₹4 lakh per person by 2047," Scindia added. He was speaking at the 7th India Ideas Conclave.

215.title: Infosys reappoints Salil Parekh as MD, CEO for 5 years
215.article_body: Infosys on Sunday said that its board has reappointed Salil Parekh as Managing Director and CEO for five more years, from July 1, 2022, to March 31, 2027. Parekh has been holding both posts since 2018 and was previously a member of the Group Executive Board at Capgemini, where he held several leadership positions for 25 years.

216.title: 2 students out to get juice fall from 2nd floor of B'luru building, 1 dies
216.article_body: Two second year BCom students fell from the second floor of a shopping complex in Bengaluru. While the girl, Liya, lost her life in the incident, her male friend, Chris Peter, has sustained injuries. The two had reportedly gone to the complex to get some juice. They lost balance on the stairs and fell from the glass window.

217.title: Man kidnapped & shot dead in Pune, his body dumped at ghat
217.article_body: Two people were arrested after a 38-year-old man was allegedly kidnapped, shot dead in Pune's Warje and his body was dumped at Tamhini Ghat. The deceased had gone missing recently, following which the police caught the duo who'd been seen accompanying him. The police recovered the body after the duo's interrogation revealed that it was dumped at the ghat.

218.title: Raj govt reduces VAT on petrol by ₹2.48 per litre, diesel by ₹1.16 per litre
218.article_body: The Rajasthan government has reduced Value-added tax (VAT) on petrol by ₹2.48 per litre and diesel by ₹1.16 per litre in the state. State Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot took to Twitter to announce the decision and said that after the move, petrol will be cheaper by ₹10.48 and diesel by ₹7.16 per litre in the state.

219.title: Woman, 2 daughters found dead at home in Delhi; suicide suspected
219.article_body: A 54-year-old woman and her two daughters were found dead at their home in Delhi on Saturday, in what police believe is a triple suicide case. DCP (Southwest) Manoj C said that prima facie, it appears that the trio died due to suffocation. The woman's husband had died due to COVID-19 last year, "since then...family had been depressed", DCP added.

220.title: Wasn't sure why they picked me: Plabita on playing fetish girl in 'Lipstick...'
220.article_body: Speaking about playing the character of a fetish girl in 'Lipstick Under My Burkha', actress Plabita Borthakur said, "Even for the fetish girl role, I wasn't sure why they picked me. I wasn't sure whether I'll be able to pull it off." "It was an unconventional film, so...I'm lucky to have started with something like that," she added.

221.title: Who will play whom in IPL 2022 playoffs?
221.article_body: Gujarat Titans and Rajasthan Royals finished as top two teams on the IPL 2022 points table and will play the Qualifier 1 on Tuesday. The winner will reach the final while the loser will play the winner of Wednesday's Eliminator between Lucknow Super Giants and Royal Challengers Bangalore. The winner of the Qualifier 2 will qualify for the final.

222.title: Congress compares excise duty on petrol and diesel in May 2014 and now
222.article_body: After the Centre reduced excise duty on fuel, Congress compared the excise duty in May 2014 and now. Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala tweeted that excise duty on petrol in May 2014 was ₹9.48/litre and it is ₹19.90/litre now after Centre's duty cut. Surjewala added that excise duty on diesel was ₹3.56/litre and it is ₹15.80/litre after the tax cut.

223.title: Mom had uterus cancer, I've never seen her; spent childhood with dad: Krushna
223.article_body: In a video shared by actor Maniesh Paul, Comedian Krushna Abhishek said his mother had uterus cancer and that he has never seen her. "I've spent my childhood with my father...I recently saw my mother...in a video...My grandmother (Govinda's mother) who was a singer...was present in the video...she was singing and my mother...was sitting with her...and singing," he added.

224.title: Petrol and diesel prices reduced after remaining unchanged for 45 days
224.article_body: Prices of petrol and diesel have been reduced after remaining unchanged for 45 days. This comes after the government reduced central excise duty on petrol and diesel. Petrol price in Delhi has been reduced from ₹105.41/litre to ₹96.72/litre. Meanwhile, diesel in Delhi now costs ₹89.62/litre. Petrol in Mumbai and Kolkata now costs ₹111.35/litre and ₹106.03/litre, respectively.

225.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as RCB qualify for playoffs?
225.article_body: MI on Saturday defeated DC by five wickets to end their campaign with four victories. With MI's victory, RCB qualified for the playoffs. RCB finished the league stage with 16 points, while DC finished the league stage with 14 points. GT topped the table with 20 points, followed by RR (18 points) and LSG (18 points). CSK finished ninth.

226.title: Ex-Pak PM praises India, says 'Despite US pressure, it bought discounted Russian oil'
226.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan praised India after the central government reduced fuel prices. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Despite being part of the Quad, India sustained pressure from the US and bought discounted Russian oil to provide relief to the masses. This is what our government was working to achieve with the help of an independent foreign policy."

227.title: One more person involved in killing of policemen in Guna arrested
227.article_body: An official said that another person involved in the killing of three policemen in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district was arrested. With this, three accused have so far been killed and five others have been arrested in the case, the official added. Earlier this month, three policemen were killed after a group of poachers opened fire on them.

228.title: RCB qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs as MI win their last match to eliminate DC
228.article_body: Bottom-placed MI on Saturday defeated DC in their last IPL 2022 match to end their campaign with four victories. With this, DC were eliminated from the playoffs race as they finished their season with 14 points from seven victories. Meanwhile, RCB became the fourth team after GT, LSG and RR to qualify for the playoffs.

229.title: Did not discuss Cabinet expansion with BJP top brass: K'taka CM
229.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that he did not discuss the issue of Cabinet expansion with the BJP top brass during his recent visit to Delhi. "I met BJP state in-charge Arun Singh...and discussed the Legislative Council and Rajya Sabha elections," Bommai said. Earlier this month, Bommai had said that Cabinet expansion will take place shortly.

230.title: 103 fake doctors found practising illegally in Maharashtra's Jalna
230.article_body: Officials said 166 unregistered medical practitioners were found practising illegally in Maharashtra's Jalna district, out of which 103 were bogus doctors. A report from the health department said that Jalna had 433 doctors, out of which 267 were registered with the Maharashtra Medical Council. The report stated that 103 bogus doctors operated in rural areas and slums, endangering lives.

231.title: Rabri Devi slaps her supporter for heckling officers during raid at her home
231.article_body: A video showing former Bihar CM Rabri Devi slapping an RJD supporter for heckling CBI officers has gone viral online. The incident took place when CBI officers raided Rabri and Lalu Yadav's Patna residence in connection to the railway recruitment scandal. Rabri is seen telling protesters to calm down and then slapping a supporter for blocking officers' exit.

232.title: Man kills wife with an axe after an argument in Sikar, arrested
232.article_body: Police said that a man was arrested after he killed his 25-year-old wife with an axe following an argument in Rajasthan's Sikar. After committing the crime, the accused ran towards railway tracks saying he was going to kill himself, Sikar's Additional Superintendent of Police said. He added that the locals caught him and handed him over to the police.

233.title: Turkey holds talks with Sweden, Finland amid their bid to join NATO
233.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Saturday discussed his concerns with Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson and Finnish President Sauli Niinistö after objecting to Sweden and Finland joining NATO. Turkey has claimed that Sweden and Finland harbour people linked to a Kurdish militant group and followers of Fethullah Gulen, whom the Turkish government accuses of orchestrating a 2016 coup attempt.

234.title: Better than nothing: Pawar over excise duty cut on petrol, diesel
234.article_body: After the government reduced the excise duty on petrol and diesel, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said, "It is better than nothing." Notably, PM Narendra Modi-led government on Saturday cut excise duty on petrol and diesel by ₹8 and ₹6 per litre, respectively. This will reduce the price of petrol by ₹9.5 per litre and of diesel by ₹7 per litre.

235.title: Ex-Pak minister Mazari beaten, taken into police custody: Family
235.article_body: Pakistan's ex-federal minister Shireen Mazari was arrested in Islamabad over a decades-old land grabbing allegation, her family said. Mazari's daughter tweeted, "Male police officers have beaten and taken my mother away. All I've been told is that Anti Corruption Wing Lahore has taken her." Notably, Islamabad High Court has ordered Mazari to be produced before it at 11:30 pm tonight.

236.title: Kartik Aaryan's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' becomes biggest Bollywood opener of 2022
236.article_body: Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani starrer 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has received the biggest opening of the year for a Bollywood film, as per a tweet by Bollywood trade analyst Taran Adarsh. It has earned ₹14.11 crore on first day of its release. The film has surpassed the first day earnings of 'Bachchhan Pandey' (₹13.25 crore) and 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' (₹10.50 crore).

237.title: IFS officer Vivek Kumar appointed as Private Secretary to PM Modi
237.article_body: Indian Foreign Service (IFS) officer Vivek Kumar has been appointed as Private Secretary (PS) to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, according to a government order. Kumar is a 2004-batch IFS officer and he is currently the director of the Prime Minister's Office (PMO). He will be succeeding Sanjeev Kumar Singla, who has been appointed as India's Ambassador to Israel.

238.title: Opposition-ruled states should also reduce fuel rates: BJP's Nadda
238.article_body: After the government reduced the excise duty on petrol and diesel, BJP chief JP Nadda said that Opposition should also reduce fuel rates in the states governed by them so that the common people can get some relief amid inflation. The excise duty cut will reduce the petrol and diesel prices by ₹9.5 per litre and ₹7 per litre, respectively.

239.title: Diplomats fixed colleges for Pt Nehru's grandkids: Rijiju as Rahul criticises IFS
239.article_body: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the current Indian Foreign Service (IFS), Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said, "Diplomats (under Congress government) were busy fixing colleges for grandkids of (ex-PM) Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru." Rijiju shared tweets by the great-grandson of a former government official, which showed ex-Foreign Secretary TN Kaul seeking advice on colleges for Rajiv Gandhi.

240.title: Healthtech startup MFine fires about 50% of its workforce: Report
240.article_body: Bengaluru-based healthtech startup MFine has fired more than 500 employees, or about 50% of its workforce, amid a funding crunch, Moneycontrol reported. The lay offs have reportedly affected employees across data science, engineering and product departments as well as talent acquisition team. MFine told employees that it is short on funds to release salaries for coming months, Moneycontrol added.

241.title: Rohit Sharma fails to hit a fifty in an IPL season for the first time ever
241.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma was dismissed for 2(13) in his team's last IPL 2022 match against DC. With this, he failed to hit a fifty in entire IPL 2022. This is the first time ever that Rohit failed to score a half century in an IPL season. Rohit's highest score in IPL 2022 was 48(36), which came against SRH.

242.title: CBFC gives Ayushmann's 'Anek' U/A certificate, removes cuss words
242.article_body: CBFC has passed Ayushmann Khurrana-starrer 'Anek' with a U/A certificate after suggesting several additions and deletions. This includes removing multiple cuss words as well as replacing 'China' and 'Chinese' to address North-Eastern girls and a dialogue around a real-life personality. CBFC also asked for the insertion of a disclaimer stating that it doesn't promote crimes committed by children.

243.title: Look forward to strengthening our ties: PM Modi to Aus PM-elect
243.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday congratulated Anthony Albanese, who is set to be Australia's next PM, for securing a victory in the Australian national election. "I look forward to working towards further strengthening our Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, and for shared priorities in the Indo-Pacific region," he tweeted. PM Modi also congratulated Albanese for Labor Party's win in the election.

244.title: 963 Americans banned from entering Russia so far: Russian ministry
244.article_body: The Russian Foreign Ministry on Saturday said that it has banned 963 US citizens from entering Russia so far. The West and Russia began to impose travel bans on individuals since the start of war in Ukraine on February 24. The ministry also said that it would continue to retaliate against what it called hostile US actions.

245.title: Madonna blocked from Instagram Live after posting nude pictures
245.article_body: Singer Madonna shared a series of videos on Instagram Stories claiming that she has been blocked from going Live on the social media platform. One of the videos shows a message from Instagram reading she has been temporarily banned for going Live. The 63-year-old had earlier shared NFTs which included a 3D animation of things coming out of her vagina.

246.title: Surprised they want to remake 'Anand': Director's granddaughter
246.article_body: Tapur Chatterji, the granddaughter of late director Hrishikesh Mukherjee, said that she was surprised to hear about his 1971 film 'Anand' being remade. Tapur further said, "It's nice to know that classics like these are still remembered and are being remade for the new generation...I hope they do justice to it." The film had starred Rajesh Khanna and Amitabh Bachchan.

247.title: Why is PM Modi reluctant to condemn riots?: Rajasthan CM
247.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot questioned why PM Narendra Modi was "reluctant" to condemn 'riots' taking place in various parts of the country, adding that the PM must condemn anti-social elements. Addressing the media on Rajiv Gandhi's death anniversary, Gehlot said, "Current government is vehement in forgetting the legacy of previous governments and former Prime Ministers."

248.title: Doja Cat says she needs tonsil surgery, will quit vaping for a while
248.article_body: American rapper Doja Cat has revealed that she needs to undergo tonsil surgery and will quit vaping "for a while". "[I'm] too scared to hit it [because] my throat hurts so bad. I cried for hours. [It's] not worth it," she tweeted. The rapper has also cancelled her performance at The Weeknd's stadium tour as well as upcoming festival dates.

249.title: Bengal BJP leaders only interested in social media politics: BJP MP
249.article_body: BJP MP Arjun Singh said that he has informed BJP National President JP Nadda that West Bengal BJP leaders are only 'interested in social media politics and not doing ground-level work'. "Delhi is looking into the matter at its own level," he said. Singh added that BJP should give responsibility to those who are capable and deserve it.

250.title: Kerala govt to cut state tax on petrol by ₹2.41 per litre, diesel by ₹1.36 per litre
250.article_body: Kerala government on Saturday announced that it will reduce state tax on the price of petrol by ₹2.41 per litre and that of diesel by ₹1.36 per litre. Earlier, the central government said it will cut excise duty on petrol and diesel by ₹8 and ₹6 per litre, respectively, to provide relief to the common man amid rising prices.

251.title: Very suspicious: Musk as Twitter refuses to explain calculation of fake accounts
251.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said it is "very suspicious" that Twitter is refusing to explain how it calculates that 5% of its daily users are fake or spam. He also agreed with a Twitter user who said that if 25% of Twitter users are bots, then the acquisition deal, which was priced at $44 billion, should cost 25% less.

252.title: India supplies another 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel to Sri Lanka
252.article_body: India on Saturday supplied another 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel to Sri Lanka amid an economic crisis in the country. Last month, India extended an additional $500 million credit line to help Sri Lanka import fuel. Separately, India's High Commission on Friday said that a ship carrying rice, milk powder and medicines from India will reach Sri Lanka on Sunday.

253.title: T'gana CM meets Kejriwal; praises Delhi's mohalla clinics, govt schools
253.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday met Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and visited Delhi government schools and mohalla clinics. Later while speaking to reporters, the Telangana CM said that the Delhi government's efforts in the field of education are commendable. "[Delhi government] sent their teachers abroad for training, now we'll send our teachers...[to Delhi] to get oriented," he added.

254.title: Felt good to hear those words: Kiccha Sudeep on PM's remark on Indian languages
254.article_body: Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep said he had no intention to spark a debate with his comments on Hindi as he praised PM Narendra Modi for calling Indian languages soul of 'Bharatiyata'. "It felt good to hear...those words," he added. Sudeep was recently involved in a Twitter exchange with Ajay Devgn over his 'Hindi is no more our national language' remark.

255.title: Can't carry sad face everywhere: Akshay on Bachchhan Paandey flopping
255.article_body: On being asked about 'Bachchhan Paandey' failing at the box office, Akshay Kumar said that you "can't carry around your sad face everywhere". He further said you can feel bad from Friday to Sunday, but you have to pick yourself up and go do another film on Monday. "Good films are only made because you enjoy the film," Akshay added.

256.title: Prez Biden signs $40 billion aid bill for Ukraine's war effort
256.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Saturday signed a bill to provide nearly $40 billion in aid for Ukraine in its fight against Russia, the White House announced. The legislation includes $20 billion in military assistance and $8 billion in general economic support. Notably, Biden signed the bill while visiting South Korea on his first trip to Asia as the President.

257.title: Sidhu hasn't eaten in nearly 24 hours in jail due to wheat allergy: Lawyer
257.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who surrendered and was taken to Patiala Jail on Friday, hasn't eaten anything since then, his lawyer HPS Verma said today. The 58-year-old has been refusing prison food as he's allergic to wheat, Verma said. He added that a court appeal has been made to make food available to Sidhu as per his dietary constraints.

258.title: Thieves perform puja before stealing gold & cash worth ₹34 lakh from finance firm in Kerala
258.article_body: Thieves performed prayer rituals before looting a private finance firm of cash and gold with a total value of ₹34 lakh in Kerala, reports have said. The puja was performed near the locker from which the cash and valuables were stolen. A note reading "I am dangerous, don't follow me" was also found at the site of the burglary.

259.title: Rahul left many issues unresolved at 'chintan shivir': Shiv Sena
259.article_body: An editorial published in the Shiv Sena mouthpiece 'Saamana' said that Congress' present condition is "miserable", which is not good for the country's democracy. It said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has left several issues unresolved at the party's recently concluded 'chintan shivir'. "This is why several leaders in different states are deserting the party," it added.

260.title: What he said is true: Raut on Rahul's 'kerosene' remark against BJP
260.article_body: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the BJP has spread kerosene all over the country and only one spark could create a big trouble, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said, "What he said is true". Raut said, "We have said the same thing in different words. It's like strangulating the country's democracy with the help of central probe agencies."

261.title: Australian PM Morrison concedes defeat in general election, Anthony Albanese to take over
261.article_body: Australian Opposition leader Anthony Albanese is set to become the country's Prime Minister as Scott Morrison admitted defeat in national elections on Saturday. "I've always believed in Australians and their judgment, and I've always been prepared to accept their verdict," said Morrison. Morrison also said he would stand down as leader of the Liberal party.

262.title: It's always people first for us: PM Modi as govt cuts excise duty on petrol, diesel
262.article_body: PM Narendra Modi tweeted "it's always people first for us" after the government announced measures to help the common man, including reduced excise duty on petrol and diesel. PM said, "Today's decisions...will positively impact various sectors, provide relief to our citizens and further 'Ease of Living'." Petrol and diesel prices will be cut by ₹9.5 and ₹7 per litre, respectively.

263.title: Helly shares pics with Aishwarya at Cannes, calls it 'fan girl moment'
263.article_body:
Television actress Helly Shah, who made her debut on the red carpet at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, met actress Aishwarya Bachchan at the festival on Friday. Helly shared a series of pictures with the actress and her daughter Aaradhya on social media, writing, "Had a fan girl moment at 
Cannes. Got to meet the [evergreen] beauty Aishwarya Rai Bachchan."

264.title: Assam-Arunachal border dispute likely to be resolved by 2023: Shah
264.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said that the boundary dispute between Arunachal Pradesh and Assam is likely to be resolved by next year. The governments of the two states are working for an amicable and permanent resolution of the dispute, he added. Separately, Shah claimed that 9,000 militants from the region have surrendered during the last eight years.

265.title: It was last minute but a great honour: Tamannaah on being at Cannes
265.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia, speaking about representing India at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, said that the opportunity was "very last minute" but it is a great honour. She added, "Mostly I'm not prepared for things that come my way but they're all so amazing." The actress further stated that she finally feels represented "properly and truly" as an Indian actor.

266.title: What announcements has the govt made amid inflation?
266.article_body: Amid inflation, government announced measures to help relieve the common man. "This year, we'll give subsidy of ₹200 per gas cylinder (upto 12 cylinders) to over 9 crore beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana," said government. "We're reducing customs duty on raw materials and intermediaries for plastic products...Import duty on some raw materials of steel will be reduced," it added.

267.title: Rainfall predicted in several states during next 5 days, IMD releases list
267.article_body: IMD has predicted rainfall in J&K, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana, UP and Rajasthan from May 21-24. Light/moderate rainfall is predicted in Bihar, Jharkhand, West Bengal, Odisha, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana from May 21-25 and in Karnataka on May 21 and 22. The eight northeastern states will also likely see rainfall during the next two days.

268.title: US lawmaker Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez announces her engagement
268.article_body: US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez has confirmed that she is engaged to her longtime partner Riley Roberts. "We got engaged last month in my family's hometown in Puerto Rico...No future details yet, we're taking some space to savour this time before diving into planning," she said. The pair had met when they were undergraduate students at Boston University.

269.title: MI to bowl first against DC in their last IPL 2022 match, Prithvi Shaw returns for DC
269.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against DC in their last IPL 2022 match. MI have made two changes to their playing XI, with Dewald Brevis and Hrithik Shokeen replacing Tristan Stubbs and Sanjay Yadav, respectively. Meanwhile, Prithvi Shaw has returned to DC's playing XI, replacing Lalit Yadav.

270.title: Stock market turmoil, crypto craze a reminder of human fear and greed: CEA
270.article_body: India's Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran said that the recent turmoil and volatility in the stock market and the craze with which people are investing in crypto assets is a "reminder that humans are still driven by fear and greed". He added, "Sometimes technology accentuates [fear and greed], rather than eliminating them."

271.title: Navi Mumbai civic body conducts cancer awareness campaign
271.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMCC) conducted a door-to-door cancer awareness campaign by circulating brochures to educate people about cancer prevention and care. "Cancer is one of the most serious concerns in the country and it becomes mandatory to reach out to people and spread awareness", an official said. The brochures contained information about endometrial, mouth and breast cancer.

272.title: Live organs transported in 27 mins via green corridor in Hyderabad
272.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police in coordination with the Cyberabad Traffic Police provided a green corridor for an ambulance carrying live organs. A pair of lungs was transported over a distance of 36.8 km in 27 minutes. The organs were transported from Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Shamshabad and KIMS Hospital in Hyderabad.

273.title: GHMC working on permanent solution to prevent floods in Hyd: Mayor
273.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is working on a permanent solution to prevent flooding, GHMC Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal said. She added that phase 1 of Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) is in progress and efforts are underway to complete it before monsoon. A GHMC press release said that 83 projects have been sanctioned at the cost of ₹954 crore.

274.title: Govt to cut central excise duty on petrol by ₹8 per litre, diesel by ₹6 per litre
274.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the government will reduce central excise duty on petrol and diesel by ₹8 and ₹6 per litre, respectively. She said, "This will reduce the price of petrol by ₹9.5 per litre and of diesel by ₹7 per litre." She also announced a subsidy of ₹200 per gas cylinder to beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana.

275.title: Thinking of stopping organ transplant procedures: Ruby Hall Clinic
275.article_body: In the wake of alleged malpractice in a kidney transplant procedure at the hospital, Pune-based Ruby Hall Clinic's CEO Bomi Bhote said, "We're considering...to stop all organ transplants." Bhote said that after conducting over 1,800 kidney transplants, the "entire effort seems futile when attempts are being made to defame the institution". The clinic's doctors have been booked in the case.

276.title: Zilingo wrongfully fired me, didn't give a chance to address concerns: Ankiti Bose
276.article_body: Singapore-based Zilingo's Indian-origin Co-founder Ankiti Bose has claimed that the company's board "wrongfully terminated" her as CEO for "insubordination". Zilingo said it had fired Bose after an investigation into complaints of "serious financial irregularities". Bose said in a statement to Reuters that the board did not give her a "chance to address fully the concerns that have been raised".

277.title: Minister invites Edinburgh University to open its campus in B'luru
277.article_body: Karnataka Higher Education Minister CN Ashwathnarayan on Friday visited the UK's Edinburgh University and held discussions with its top officials. The minister invited them to set up a university's campus in Bengaluru to collaborate with educational institutions for learning and adopting innovative methods. The university's officials have responded positively to his proposal, his office said.

278.title: Telangana CM KCR meets SP chief Akhilesh Yadav in New Delhi
278.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao met Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav at the former's official residence on the Tughlaq Road in New Delhi. "The two leaders discussed current national issues," an official statement said. Notably, Rao is in Delhi as part of his week-long tour to attend national-level political and social programmes, according to a report.

279.title: Hyderabad Police seize 500 bottles of hash oil, 7 arrested
279.article_body: The Hyderabad Police busted an interstate drug peddling gang and arrested four drug peddlers and three consumers. Police recovered 500 bottles of hash oil, one car and six mobile phones, worth ₹10 lakh altogether. Police said that each bottle contained 5 ml of hash oil. The accused were selling each bottle to consumers for ₹2,000-₹2,500, they added.

280.title: 2 try to extort ₹10 lakh from Mumbai man by accusing him of rape, held
280.article_body: Police said they arrested two men for assaulting and trying to extort ₹10 lakh from a Mumbai-based businessman with the help of their female accomplice. The businessman in his statement said that the woman came close to him and when he tried to stop her, the two men accused him of raping her. They later demanded ₹10 lakh from him.

281.title: Siddhant Chaturvedi gives surprise performance at Divine's concert
281.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi on Friday made a surprise appearance at rapper Divine's concert in Mumbai and performed as his 'Gully Boy' character MC Sher. The 2019 film was based on the lives of Indian rappers Divine and Naezy. Siddhant also took to social media to share pictures of his appearance, writing that Divine invited him and he didn't think twice.

282.title: Only 35% nullah cleaning work completed in Mumbai: BJP
282.article_body: BJP MLA Ashish Shelar criticised Mumbai's civic body BMC and claimed that only 35% of nullah cleaning work has been completed in the city. "The Shiv Sena-led BMC needs to explain why 65% of nullah cleaning work has remained incomplete. Who is responsible?" Shelar questioned. Shelar's statements came after he inspected the progress of nullah cleaning work on Thursday.

283.title: Boy rapes 13-yr-old girl in Gurugram while his friend stands guard
283.article_body: Police have arrested a 17-year-old boy for allegedly raping a 13-year-old girl in Gurugram. The sister of the victim has alleged that the accused had barged into her sister's room when she was sleeping and raped her, while his 15-year-old friend locked the room from outside and stood guard. The accused's friend has also been arrested by the police.

284.title: No one can say a virus will become pandemic, no need to panic: Doctor on monkeypox cases
284.article_body: Amid detection of monkeypox cases in some foreign countries, a health expert insisted on observing its evolution while also advising not to panic. "No one can say for a fact that a virus will become a pandemic," said Dr Ishwar Gilada. "Monkeypox is zoonotic like HIV that initially came as monkey virus called simian immunodeficiency virus," he added.

285.title: 113 flyers made to wait at B'luru airport as gate key goes missing
285.article_body: About 113 passengers arriving at Bengaluru airport were reportedly made to wait for over 20 minutes at an arrival gate leading to the terminal after a security personnel was unable to unlock the gate, a report said. Meanwhile, journalist Vir Sanghvi, who tweeted about the incident, claimed the delay was caused because the key of the arrival gate went missing.

286.title: RCB change profile picture on social media in support of MI
286.article_body: RCB on Saturday changed their profile picture on their social media channels in support of MI ahead of their match against DC. RCB need MI to win to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs. "#RedTurnsBlue for today! We're backing you to #PlayBold all the way. Go get 'em, champs!" RCB tweeted. RCB will be knocked out if DC beat MI.

287.title: Air India bans smoking, consumption of intoxicating substances at workplace
287.article_body: Tata Group-run Air India has banned smoking and consumption of intoxicating substances at the workplace. In a letter to staff, Air India's CHRO Suresh Dutt Tripathi wrote that Air India is a responsible organisation which aims to provide a safe and healthy work environment. "We have zero-tolerance for violations...Any violation...will be dealt with appropriate consequences," Tripathi further said.

288.title: DU professor Ratan Lal who was arrested for post on Gyanvapi Mosque, gets bail
288.article_body: A Delhi court has granted bail to Delhi University professor Ratan Lal who was arrested on Friday over a social media post on the alleged discovery of Shivling inside the Gyanvapi Mosque. "The feeling of hurt felt by an individual cannot represent an entire group or community," said the court. Lal got bail on furnishing of ₹50,000 bond and surety.

289.title: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has ended Bollywood's dry spell: Kangana
289.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Saturday took to Instagram Stories to write, "Congratulations to 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' for ending the dry spell at Hindi box office. Congratulations to [the] entire team of the film." Trade analyst Taran Adarsh has stated that the film is actor Kartik Aaryan's biggest opener at the box office with a business of ₹14.11 crore in India.

290.title: Magazine once asked me to have 'affair' they could 'expose': Himanshu
290.article_body: Actor Himanshu Malik, known for his role in 2001 film 'Tum Bin', has revealed that he once got a call from a magazine publication asking him to have "an affair with an upcoming actress". Himanshu added that they even offered to book a hotel room in Goa. "I was told, 'You just go there and we will expose'," he said.

291.title: Any meeting with Kim Jong-un would depend on sincerity, says Biden
291.article_body: Speaking on a potential meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, US President Joe Biden has said, "It would depend on whether he was sincere and whether he was serious." Biden made the comment during his visit to South Korea. Notably, Biden's predecessor Donald Trump had met Kim three times, before diplomatic talks between the two countries ended in 2019.

292.title: Cricketer Deepak Chahar's sister Malti to make debut with 'Ishq Pashmina'
292.article_body: Cricketer Deepak Chahar's sister Malti Chahar is set to make her Bollywood debut with 'Ishq Pashmina'. Malti will be seen opposite influencer and actor Bhavin Bhanushali. "My character in this film is very unique and I hope the audience shower the film with...love," Malti said. Directed by Arvind Pandey, 'Ishq Pashmina' also stars Zarina Wahab and Brijendra Kala.

293.title: 6 bodies recovered from tunnel collapse site in J&K, 4 still missing
293.article_body: Six bodies have been recovered so far from the debris of an under-construction tunnel that collapsed on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway in the Ramban district on Thursday. Ramban Deputy Commissioner Mussarat Islam has said that three bodies have been identified and all were from West Bengal. The operation to locate at least four others is continuing.

294.title: Regret not taking care of myself: Arjun on his physical transformation
294.article_body: Arjun Kapoor, while talking about his recent physical transformation, said his extra work took a toll on him "mentally, emotionally and physically" and he regrets not taking care of himself. "I had implemented a very good lifestyle when I...started as an actor, somewhere that went away," he said, adding that it was COVID that gave him a reality check.

295.title: My coldest shoot ever: Parineeti on shooting at minus 12 degrees
295.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra is currently shooting for her upcoming project with singer-actor Harrdy Sandhu at a high altitude location. The actress took to Instagram on Friday to share the struggles of shooting at minus 12 degrees. "My coldest shoot ever. The best part was my hero also had to wear a thin costume and feel cold," Parineeti captioned the video.

296.title: Bihar's most-wanted gangster Azad Ali arrested in Delhi
296.article_body: Bihar's most-wanted gangster Azad Ali was arrested in Delhi by a special cell of Delhi Police on Saturday. The 43-year-old accused was held near Ring Road at Rajghat with the help of a tip-off. Ali was wanted in a shootout case during the Bihar's Vidhan Parishad election and a single-shot pistol was recovered from him, police said.

297.title: Prithviraj Chauhan was a Gurjar king, not Rajput: Gurjar body
297.article_body: Akhil Bharatiya Veer Gurjar Mahasabha has claimed that Prithviraj Chauhan was a Gurjar ruler and not a Rajput ruler. The body has also demanded that the producers of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' portray him as a Gurjar ruler in the film. The body's state president Manish Bhargad has asserted that the producers assured them nothing against the community will be portrayed.

298.title: GMDA lays 22-km long pipelines to use wastewater for public parks
298.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority has laid out 22 km of lateral pipelines along roads in order to maximise the use of treated wastewater for watering Gurugram's green belts and parks. The GMDA has planned to install 100 km of lateral pipelines in 2022-23, an official said. The major spots include Huda City Centre, Bakhtawar Chowk and IFFCO Chowk.

299.title: Bad decision, there's a clear deflection: Sachin on Wade's dismissal vs RCB
299.article_body: Reacting to GT's Matthew Wade's dismissal against RCB following a review for LBW, Sachin Tendulkar said, "[It was] unfortunate. He received a bad decision." "There was a clear deflection," added Sachin. Wade was seen throwing his bat and helmet in the dressing room after his dismissal resulting in him being reprimanded for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct.

300.title: Don't think myself as favourite for this year's French Open: Nadal
300.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal has said that he doesn't think of himself as a "favourite" for the upcoming French Open tournament despite winning the competition for the most number of times in history. "Unfortunately...I didn't have the preparation that I would like, and unfortunately, that rib fracture stopped a little bit (of momentum)," the 35-year-old said.

301.title: Playing for next 3 yrs at least: Shikhar Dhawan
301.article_body: After not getting picked in the Indian squad for the last year's T20 World Cup, 36-year-old batter Shikhar Dhawan has said that he is going to continue playing for "next three years at least". "I can contribute in the shortest format because of my experience...I have managed to stay consistent in the formats that I am playing," Dhawan said.

302.title: 12-year-old rape survivor gives birth in Tamil Nadu; neighbour arrested
302.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating his 12-year-old neighbour in Tamil Nadu's Tirupathur. The girl was admitted to hospital for stomach ache last month, where doctors found she was pregnant. On being questioned, she told her mother that the accused raped her repeatedly when she was alone at home. She delivered a baby on May 3.

303.title: Telecom regulator planning KYC-based caller's identification system
303.article_body: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is planning to develop a KYC-based system that can help people identify a caller’s identity on a mobile phone, as per an official. Referring to it, Truecaller said, "Number identification is crucial to ending the menace of spam...calls...We appreciate this move...and would like to reiterate that we remain very supportive of this."

304.title: Rahul calls Indian Foreign Service 'arrogant', 'it's confidence', says Jaishankar
304.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has responded to Rahul Gandhi's remarks calling Indian Foreign Service officers "arrogant". "Yes, the Indian Foreign Service has changed. Yes, they follow the orders of the Government. Yes, they counter the arguments of others. No, it's not called Arrogance. It is called Confidence," said Jaishankar. Rahul made the remarks at Cambridge University in London.

305.title: Kolkata man hired women to honey trap & blackmail men; arrested
305.article_body: Kolkata Police arrested a man from Hare Street for allegedly setting up honey traps for men and blackmailing them for money. According to police, the accused would hire women who engaged in conversations with various men. They recorded video calls with them while posing nude. The accused used these videos to blackmail men and demanded money from them, police said.

306.title: Pune civic body seals 221 kiosks over non-payment of license fee
306.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has sealed 221 kiosks in Tulsibaug over non-payment of license fees. The PMC has said that it's owed ₹3 crore by kiosk owners as per the revised rates approved by the general body in 2018. "We had been sending notices since 2018 demanding dues to be paid but to no avail," a senior official said.

307.title: India's AstroSat witnesses black hole birth for 500th time in space
307.article_body: AstroSat, India's dedicated astronomy mission, has detected the birth of a black hole for the 500th time, Pune-based research institution IUCAA has said. It added that India is making great headway in studying the birth of these black holes. A black hole is a place in space where gravity is so strong that even light cannot escape its pull.

308.title: Was taken aback by her preparation: Akshay on 'Prithviraj' co-star Manushi
308.article_body: Akshay Kumar, while talking about his 'Prithviraj' co-star Manushi Chhillar, said he was taken aback by the actress' preparation for her role. Akshay added, "She knew she had a responsibility towards the character and she has essayed Sanyogita beautifully." "She learnt in her first film what I learnt...by my 25th film," he said while calling Manushi a natural actor.

309.title: Umpire guards MS Dhoni as fan invades ground to meet him, video goes viral
309.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a fan invading the ground to meet CSK captain MS Dhoni during CSK's match against RR on Friday. In the video, the umpire can be seen guarding MS Dhoni from a distance as the fan tried to approach the cricketer. The incident happened when Dhoni was standing near the non-striker's end while batting.

310.title: 4, including ex-BJP MP's nephew, killed in road accident in Chhattisgarh
310.article_body: At least four persons were killed after a truck rammed into a mini goods vehicle in which they were travelling on Friday in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur, police said. One of the deceased was the nephew of former BJP MP from Bilaspur, Lakhan Lal Sahu, police added. Three of the victims died on the spot, another died in a hospital, police stated.

311.title: US, other APEC delegates walk out on Russian speaker
311.article_body: Representatives from the US and four other countries on Saturday staged a walkout when a Russian representative began his opening remarks at a meeting of trade ministers of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation group in Bangkok, officials said. The walkout was "an expression of disapproval at Russia's illegal war...in Ukraine and its economic impact in the APEC region", a diplomat said.

312.title: Feel like a racehorse scratching its stall and wanting to race: Federer
312.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said he feels like a racehorse scratching its stall and wanting to race. "I'm ready to give it my all again," added Federer. "I am looking forward to coming home in the evening after the tough day of training and being completely exhausted," he stated. Federer has been out of action since July 2021.

313.title: Ford's internet-linked cars face nationwide sales ban in Germany
313.article_body: A German court has put a nationwide sales and production ban on Ford cars that are able to establish an internet connection, in a case over violation of wireless technology patents. The verdict is not legally binding and can still be appealed. The plaintiff, Japan's IP Bridge, needs to make a $240-million security payment for it to become "provisionally enforceable".

314.title: Doctors are being made scapegoats: ISOT on Ruby Hall Clinic case
314.article_body: The Indian Society of Nephrology (ISN) and the Indian Society of Organ Transplantation (ISOT) have condemned the handling of the case related to alleged malpractices in a kidney transplant procedure at Pune's Ruby Hall Clinic. "Doctors are being made scapegoats," Sunil Shroff, ISOT's President said. Police have booked 15 people, including some doctors of Ruby Hall Clinic, in the case.

315.title: 65-year-old man killed by tiger in Maharashtra's Chandrapur
315.article_body: A 65-year-old man was killed by a tiger in a forest area near Chandrapur, Maharashtra. The incident happened after the deceased, identified as Dashrath Pendor, had gone into the forests to graze goats on Friday, an official said. A big cat, identified as Waghadoh, is roaming in the area and the forest department is yet to catch it, official said.

316.title: Hoping to bag 4 titles by season end: Liverpool's Mo Salah
316.article_body: After already bagging the FA Cup and League Cup, Liverpool's Mohamed Salah is hoping that the club can make a quadruple by winning this year's Champions League final and the Premier League title. "I wish Manchester City lose or draw, and we win the Premier League," Salah said. "I am very excited about the (Champions League) final," he added.

317.title: Moselle Open 2010 win much better than beating Nadal or Federer: Simon
317.article_body: Former world number six Gilles Simon said winning the Moselle Open in 2010 was "much better" than defeating Rafael Nadal or Roger Federer, having beaten them in 2008. "We are talking about tennis performance," added Simon. Discussing his decision to retire from tennis at the end of the 2022 season, he stated that everything seems too difficult.

318.title: K'taka minister invites UK university to set up campus in B'luru
318.article_body: Karnataka Higher Education Minister Dr CN Ashwathnarayan on Friday invited officials from the UK's Edinburgh University to open its campus in Bengaluru, the minister's office said in a statement. He had done so during his visit to the over 400-year-old university. "Edinburgh University is renowned for multi-disciplinary education which is also the core of the National Education Policy," he said.

319.title: Will follow court's order: Rajasthan Min on rape case against son
319.article_body: Speaking on accusation against son for raping 23-year-old woman, Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi said that the case is sub judice and they will follow court's orders. "Police are doing their job and so is the law. Law is same for everyone," he said. On May 8, Delhi Police filed a rape case against his son, Rohit, on the woman's complaint.

320.title: Offered COVID-19 vaccines to North Korea, got no response: US
320.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Saturday said America had offered North Korea and China COVID-19 vaccines but "got no response". North Korea, which reported its first outbreak of COVID-19 earlier this month, has recorded nearly 25 lakh "fever" cases and 66 deaths despite a "maximum emergency" epidemic campaign. North Korea is yet to start a mass vaccination campaign against COVID-19.

321.title: Cryptos are worth nothing, based on nothing: European Central Bank chief
321.article_body: European Central Bank's President Christine Lagarde said, "My very humble assessment is that it (cryptocurrency) is worth nothing, it is based on nothing, there is no underlying asset to act as an anchor of safety." Stating that she's concerned about people who have no understanding of the risks related to cryptocurrencies, Lagarde said that cryptocurrencies should be regulated.

322.title: Mentally ill man slapped, asked 'Is your name Mohammed?'; later found dead in MP
322.article_body: A missing mentally ill man named Bhanwarlal Jain was found dead in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch and a video showing a man asking him if his "name is Mohammed", and repeatedly slapping him has surfaced on social media. The attacker in the video has been identified as Dinesh Kushwaha, who is reportedly the husband of a former BJP corporator.

323.title: Investor's defamation case against Musk, his fan & Tesla dismissed
323.article_body: A defamation and securities fraud lawsuit against Tesla, CEO Elon Musk and a Musk fan, brought forward by a Tesla investor Aaron Greenspan, has been dismissed. A US judge found that the lawsuit had failed to make plausible legal claims. The lawsuit alleged that Omar Qazi, a Musk fan, defamed Greenspan in his tweets that made baseless accusations against him.

324.title: Female dancer, others shoot dance video at Pune's Lal Mahal; booked
324.article_body: Female Marathi dancer Vaishnavi Patil and a few others have been booked for shooting a Lavani dance video at Pune's Lal Mahal, where Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj spent several years of his childhood, an official said on Saturday. According to officials, the accused hadn't taken permission for shooting the video. Meanwhile, Patil issued an apology after political leaders condemned the video.

325.title: I like investing in things with valuable output: Gates on why he doesn't own crypto
325.article_body: Microsoft's Co-founder Bill Gates in an interaction revealed why he doesn't own any cryptocurrencies. He said, "I like investing in things that have valuable output. The value of companies is based on how they make great products. The value of cryptocurrency is just what some other person decides someone else will pay...so not adding to society like other investments."

326.title: Existence of over 500 lost animal species remains uncertain: Study
326.article_body: After reviewing 32,802 species from the IUCN Red List, researchers have identified 562 lost species. These species haven't been seen by anyone in over 50 years but they are not yet considered extinct, the study stated. Such species with an uncertain conservation status may create problems in future as the extinction crisis worsens and more species go missing, researchers said.

327.title: Paytm posts ₹762.5 cr loss in Q4, says 'on track to break-even by Sept 2023'
327.article_body: Paytm has reported a loss of ₹762.5 crore for the March quarter of the financial year 2021-22, up 72% from ₹444.4 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal. The company's revenue from operations were up by 89% year-on-year at ₹1,541 crore for the quarter. Paytm said it is "on track to achieve break-even by quarter ending September 2023".

328.title: Over 2,000 fire-related incidents reported in Delhi so far in May
328.article_body: Delhi Fire Services on Friday said that over 2,000 (2,145) fire-related incidents were reported in the national capital in the first 19 days of May this year. Furthermore, it said that 42 people were killed and 117 were injured in such incidents. The Mundka blaze that killed about 27 people was among the major fire incidents in May, officials said.

329.title: Account hacked: Adhir Ranjan as Rajiv Gandhi quote on Sikh riots tweeted by his handle
329.article_body: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has filed a police complaint claiming his Twitter account was hacked, after a 1984 quote by former PM Rajiv Gandhi was tweeted from his account. The now-deleted tweet had Rajiv Gandhi's "Whenever a big tree falls, the earth shakes" remark that he made after the deadly Sikh riots that followed Indira Gandhi's death.

330.title: Vijay Shekhar Sharma reappointed CEO and MD of Paytm for 5 years
330.article_body: Paytm on Saturday said that its board of Directors have approved the reappointment of Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma as Managing Director (MD) and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the company. Sharma's reappointment is effective for a tenure of 5 years till December 18, 2027. Further, Paytm's board has also approved the appointment of its CFO Madhur Deora as Whole-time Director.

331.title: Pune Police book 4 foreigners for stealing crypto tokens
331.article_body: Four foreigners, including three Vietnamese and a Bangladeshi, have been booked by Pune Police for stealing crypto tokens worth ₹24 lakh from a city-based company. The theft took place after one of the accused was hired by the company to develop a server node, the police said. The other accused had helped the main accused in the theft, they said.

332.title: DU students protest after professor held over post on 'Shivling'
332.article_body: The students of Delhi University on Friday staged a protest after police arrested the Hindu College Associate Professor, Ratan Lal, over an alleged derogatory social media post. The professor's post was reportedly in connection with the claims of a 'Shivling' found at Varanasi's Gyanvapi Mosque. Police have said that Lal had allegedly "intended to outrage reli­gious beliefs" in his post.

333.title: UK PM Boris Johnson's father becomes French citizen
333.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson's father, Stanley Johnson, has secured French citizenship. "This decision concerns...Stanley Johnson only and doesn't extend to his descendants," French Justice Ministry said. The development means that the 81-year-old, whose mother was French, will retain all the rights of EU citizenship that British citizens lost after Brexit. He doesn't have to give up his UK nationality.

334.title: How did MS Dhoni perform in IPL 2022 as compared to other seasons?
334.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni scored 232 runs in IPL 2022, the third-lowest amount of runs he scored in a season. He had a batting average of 33.14 as compared to 16.28 in IPL 2021. Dhoni, who had a strike rate of 116.27 and 106.54 in IPL 2020 and IPL 2021 respectively, recorded a strike rate of 123.40 in IPL 2022.

335.title: RCB's Dinesh Karthik shares old pic in MI jersey to show support for MI against DC
335.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik took to Twitter to share a picture of himself in MI jersey to show support for MI ahead of their match against DC. "Found this in archives," wrote Karthik followed by a 'fingers crossed' emoji. RCB will qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs if MI defeat DC, however, they will be eliminated if DC win.

336.title: Sushmita Sen celebrates 28 years of her Miss Universe win
336.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen on Saturday took to social media to celebrate 28 years of her winning the Miss Universe title. She wrote in the caption, "Beautiful is a feeling. Happy 28 years of INDIA winning Miss Universe for the very first time!! Time flies...Beauty remains!!!" A fan page of Sushmita also shared a video from the pageant on social media.

337.title: Shivling found in Gyanvapi mosque is one of 12 Jyotirlingas: VHP chief
337.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) chief Alok Kumar on Friday claimed that the Shivling reportedly found at Gyanvapi mosque is one of the 12 Jyotirlingas. "The location suggests that it's one of the...12 Jyotirlingas...Gyanvapi mosque complex has been built over the ruins of the desecrated old temple invaded by Mughals...We will be able to prove it to the court," Kumar claimed.

338.title: Upper-caste students at U'khand govt school refuse to eat food cooked by Dalit
338.article_body: A number of upper-caste students boycotted mid-day meals prepared by a Dalit cook in a government school in Uttarakhand's Champawat district. "Around 7-8 students have again refused to eat the food cooked by Sunita Devi," the principal said. The cook was sacked last year after 66 students refused to eat meals prepared by her. She was later reappointed.

339.title: What more do MI need for Rohit? Rohit fans, Kohli fans are all with him: Ravi Shastri
339.article_body: Ahead of MI-DC match, former India head coach Ravi Shastri said that he believes Rohit Sharma will come good in his team's last league match in IPL 2022. "What more do MI need for Rohit? Rohit fans, Virat Kohli fans, RCB fans are all with him," he added. Notably, RCB need MI to defeat DC to qualify for the playoffs.

340.title: Akshay too big for these small things: Anees on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
340.article_body: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director Anees Bazmee, speaking about not casting Akshay Kumar in the film, said that the actor is "too big for these small things". The director further said that he has brought back a few things from the first film like the haveli, Rajpal Yadav's character, Monjulika and the songs 'Aami Je Tomar' and 'Teri Aankhein Bhool Bhulaiyaa'.

341.title: Only diplomacy can end Ukraine war: Zelenskyy
341.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the war in Ukraine "will be bloody, there will be fighting but will only definitively end through diplomacy". Negotiations between Russia and Ukraine are at a standstill, with both nations accusing each other of intransigence. "We want everything to return [to as it was before]" but "Russia doesn't want that", Zelenskyy added without elaborating.

342.title: Musk says Dogecoin Co-creator Palmer is 'little negative at times'
342.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Dogecoin Co-creator Jackson Palmer can be a "little negative at times". He said this in response to Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus urging Twitter users to listen to Jackson talking about cryptocurrency's "silliness" in a podcast, even if they disagree with him. Responding to Musk, Markus jokingly said, "I don't disagree."

343.title: Woman awarded ₹72 lakh after not being invited for drinks by colleagues in UK
343.article_body: A 51-year-old casino cashier in the UK was awarded £74,113 (around ₹72 lakh) by an employment tribunal as compensation after she claimed she was 'shunned' by her colleagues. Rita Leher said her colleagues at Aspers Casino went out for drinks and she was the only one who wasn't invited. Her colleagues had also discussed the outing in front of her.

344.title: Just don't knock me out: Salman on Nikhat Zareen's boxing gold
344.article_body: After Nikhat Zareen won the gold medal at the Women's World Boxing Championships 2022, actor Salman Khan congratulated her on Twitter, writing, "Congratzz." In a separate tweet, Salman wrote, "Just don't knock me out...keep punching like my hero Sylvester Stallone." Nikhat was earlier asked if 'Salman Bhai' congratulated her, to which she said, "Whose brother? Your brother...He is my jaan."

345.title: Prez Kovind gives kits to aspiring cricketers in St Vincent and Grenadines
345.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind handed over eight cricket kits to aspiring cricketers in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. Recently, President Kovind gifted cricket kits to the Jamaica Cricket Association as well. President Kovind, who is on a four-day visit to the Caribbean nation, is the first Indian President ever to visit Saint Vincent and the Grenadines.

346.title: Russia says it destroyed large weapons consignment from US, Europe in Ukraine
346.article_body: Russia on Saturday said that it had destroyed a major consignment of Western arms in Ukraine's Zhytomyr region using sea-launched Kalibr cruise missiles. The strike took out "a large batch of weapons and military equipment delivered from the USA and European countries" and intended for Ukrainian troops, it further said.

347.title: People judge based on what they see, can be really hard for players: Ana
347.article_body: Ex-world number one tennis player Ana Ivanovic said people make judgements according to what they see which is not the full story in most cases, adding it can get "really hard" for players to get over it. "[It] upsets me," stated Ana. She said there is a lot more pressure on women to perform in tennis in comparison to men.

348.title: Karnataka gives 33% reservation to women in outsourced government jobs
348.article_body: Karnataka government has granted 33% reservation to women in outsourced government jobs. Chief Secretary P Ravi Kumar issued a circular in this regard on Friday. Out of 7.2 lakh sanctioned posts in Karnataka with around 4.6 lakh employees, there are around 1.5 lakh outsourced staff. Hence, around 50,000 posts will be reserved for women employees now.

349.title: 2 railway workers held over hoax bomb threat tweets about train in MP
349.article_body: Two railway contract workers were arrested in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain over hoax bomb threat tweets about a train, the police said on Friday. The accused claimed that they had made the tweets to delay the train so as to spend more time with their families. The tweets were made on May 11 and May 18, according to the police.

350.title: 57 US lawmakers seek FBI probe into killing of Al Jazeera journalist
350.article_body: Fifty-seven US lawmakers have called on the FBI to investigate the killing of Al Jazeera reporter Shireen Abu Akleh. She was shot dead during an Israeli military raid in West Bank on May 11. "As an American...Abu Akleh was entitled to...full protections afforded to US citizens living abroad," lawmakers wrote to State Secretary Antony Blinken and FBI Director Christopher Wray.

351.title: Sri Lanka lifts state of emergency after 2 weeks as law & order situation improves
