351.article_body: The Sri Lankan government on Saturday lifted the state of emergency, nearly two weeks after it was imposed amid anti-government protests over the nation's worst economic crisis. As per the authorities, the move was taken with the improvement of the law and order situation. President Gotabaya Rajapaksa had declared a state of emergency with effect from May 6 midnight.

352.title: Expectations don't pressurise me, but help me evolve as actor: Kiara
352.article_body: Kiara Advani, in an interview, said she doesn't feel pressured by expectations, rather they have helped her evolve as an actor. She added that she did not sign her first pan-India film out of any pressure, but because her fans wanted so. "When you see people think that you are worth it, it is a beautiful feeling," Kiara said.

353.title: Hyd's Skyroot test fires solid fuel engine of its rocket 'Vikram-1'
353.article_body: Hyderabad-based space startup Skyroot has successfully test fired a solid fuel-based engine that will be used as the third stage in its rocket, 'Vikram-1'. The rocket stage, dubbed 'Kalam 100', was fired in testing facilities for the full duration of 108 seconds. Vikram-1 is capable of putting 225-kilogram payloads into sun-synchronous polar orbit.

354.title: 2 Delhi residents held in Pune for posing as GST officers
354.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Police held two men, residents of Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar area, for allegedly cheating people by posing as GST officers. The accused, identified as Manojkumar Chabinath and Omprakash Pande, were arrested after a complaint was filed against them by trader Shadan Khan at Pune's Chikhali police station. The duo had allegedly demanded money from Khan, police said.

355.title: Excise dept gives first 'home bar' licence in Ghaziabad district
355.article_body: The excise department issued a home bar licence to a Ghaziabad resident which is first such licence to be issued in the district. As per UP's excise policy, one needs to have licence to keep more than two bottles of liquor at home and on obtaining the licence one can keep maximum 84 (750ml) bottles of different types at home.

356.title: Nick Jonas gifts customised car to Priyanka Chopra, actress shares pic
356.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra took to Instagram to share a picture of the customised car gifted to her by husband Nick Jonas. She can be seen sitting in an all terrain vehicle (ATV) with the words 'Mrs Jonas' written on the side. Sharing the picture, Priyanka wrote, "Now that's a ride...Thank you @nickjonas...always helping me with my cool quotient."

357.title: I'm not a billionaire anymore: Ethereum's 28-yr-old Co-founder Buterin
357.article_body: Ethereum's 28-year-old Co-founder Vitalik Buterin on Friday tweeted that he is "not a billionaire anymore" after a massive sell-off in the cryptocurrency market recently. Buterin, who created Ethereum in 2014, became the world's youngest crypto billionaire last year. A digital wallet held by Buterin contained crypto holdings worth about $1.5 billion as recently as November, Bloomberg reported.

358.title: Don't see Cong as 'big daddy': Rahul after criticism on his regional parties remark
358.article_body: After Rahul Gandhi was criticised for his remarks saying regional parties 'lacked ideologies' to take on BJP, the Congress leader said his comments were misconstrued. "I don't view Congress as the big daddy," said Rahul at a Cambridge University event. "In no way is Congress superior to the other opposition parties. We're all fighting the same battle," he added.

359.title: Pete Davidson to exit Saturday Night Live after 8 seasons: Report
359.article_body: Comedian Pete Davidson will reportedly exit Saturday Night Live after eight seasons. Davidson is expected to quit the show during the season 47 finale this weekend, reports added. According to Variety, the comedian made his debut on Saturday Night Live in 2014 as one of the youngest cast members at the age of 20.

360.title: Got drunk after winning US Open 2005, felt nauseous for days: Federer
360.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said the last time he got drunk was in 2005 after defeating former world number one Andre Agassi in the final of the US Open. "We ordered a few...shots, after which I was nauseous for days. But actually I never lose control," added Federer. "I...like to drink champagne to celebrate special moments," he stated.

361.title: Waited inside aircraft for 3 hrs: Dia after Vistara flight gets diverted & cancelled
361.article_body: Dia Mirza took to Twitter after her Delhi bound flight was diverted and then cancelled. Complaining to Vistara about the lack of assistance regarding it, she tweeted that while they waited inside the aircraft for three hours before the flight was cancelled, "No one from the airport authority or Vistara" were there to offer any answers.

362.title: Jharkhand to paint govt schools green, white; BJP criticises move
362.article_body: After the Jharkhand Education Project Council issued an order for government schools across the state to be painted in green and white shades, the BJP alleged that the move was politically motivated as the colours are associated with the state's ruling party JMM. However, state Education Minister Jagarnath Mahto told PTI that the colours were chosen based on "experts' recommendations".

363.title: 65-yr-old differently-abled man beaten to death in Madhya Pradesh
363.article_body: A 65-year-old differently-abled man was allegedly beaten to death in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch on Friday. A video of the incident has reportedly gone viral on social media. "Bhanwarlal Jain was beaten...over suspicion of belonging to a particular religion. The accused person Dinesh Kushwaha, in...video, can be seen asking 'show me your identity card' while thrashing him," a police official said.

364.title: Bangladeshi national contested 2021 Assembly seat for TMC: Calcutta HC
364.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) candidate Alo Rani Sarkar, who contested the Bongaon South Assembly seat in 2021, is a Bangladeshi national by virtue of birth, the Calcutta High Court said on Friday. HC was hearing Sarkar's petition that challenged the poll results that were declared on May 2, 2021. BJP's Swapan Majumdar had defeated Sarkar by around 2,000 votes.

365.title: Targeted attempts trying to disable our internet resources: Putin
365.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said "targeted attempts" are being made to "disable...internet resources of Russia's critical...infrastructure". "Attempts to illegally penetrate...corporate networks of leading Russian companies are much more frequent as well," he added. Putin said Russia will need to improve information security in key sectors and switch to using domestic technology.

366.title: 2-day 'Chintan Shivir' to be held in Chandigarh by Haryana Cong
366.article_body: Congress' Haryana unit will be organising a two-day 'Chintan Shivir' in Chandigarh on May 31 and June 1. The meet will be held to implement the resolution in the state, passed in the recently concluded 'Chintan Shivir' in Udaipur. The decision to hold 'Chintan Shivir' was taken in a meeting chaired by Haryana Congress State President Udai Bhan on Friday.

367.title: Over 1.2 bn people face fatal health risks from extreme heat: Report
367.article_body: Over 1.2 billion people worldwide face fatal health risks due to extreme heat and a lack of cooling, report by Sustainable Energy for All stated. The numbers this year have increased by 28 million as compared to 2021. The report also called for investment in solutions like tree planting, affordable hyper-efficient air conditioners, well-designed buildings etc to tackle the crisis.

368.title: Revenue from beer increases in Pune as sales surge by 30 lakh litres
368.article_body: Beer sales in Pune increased by 30 lakh litres in the month of April and May because of which the revenue of the state increased by ₹213 crore, Maharashtra's excise department data showed. "Alcohol sales in Maharashtra have picked up again in 2021-22, especially during the COVID-19 period of 2020-21," Confederation of Indian Alcoholic Beverage Companies' President Deepak Roy said.

369.title: 75 mohalla clinics to be set up by August 15 in Punjab: CM Bhagwant Mann
369.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Friday announced that 75 mohalla clinics will be set up before India's 75th Independence Day on August 15. "Will fulfil the promise of providing excellent and free treatment to the people of Punjab," Mann tweeted. "The government...identified 130 defunct Sewa Kendras and Saanjh Kendras...will be converted into mohalla clinics," state Health Minister Vijay Singla said.

370.title: 16-year-old Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa defeats world no. 1 Carlsen for 2nd time in 2022
370.article_body: India's 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the fifth round of the Chessable Masters online rapid chess tournament on Friday. It is R Praggnanandhaa's second victory against Carlsen in 2022. He had earlier defeated Carlsen in the eighth round of the Airthings Masters in February.

371.title: Chahal has answered RCB by becoming IPL 2022's leading wicket-taker: Akhtar
371.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said Yuzvendra Chahal had a point to prove to his former franchise RCB, having been released ahead of the IPL mega auction. "[Releasing him] was like telling him, 'Listen, you aren't good enough'. Chahal has answered [RCB] by becoming...IPL 2022's leading wicket-taker [so far]," added Akhtar. Chahal has picked 26 wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

372.title: Russia likely facing Uncrewed Aerial Vehicles shortage: UK
372.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said Russian forces in Ukraine are likely experiencing a shortage of appropriate reconnaissance Uncrewed Aerial Vehicles (UAVs), used to "identify targets to be struck by combat jets or artillery". "If Russia continues to lose UAVs at...current rate, Russian forces...reconnaissance capability will be further degraded, negatively impacting operational effectiveness," it added.

373.title: US university's students create edible tortilla tape to fix wrap problem
373.article_body: A team of chemical and biomolecular engineering students at the Johns Hopkins University has made an edible tortilla tape to fix wrap problem. The 'Tastee Tape' can be used to seal the wrap or burrito and avoid fillings from falling. The tape is clear, however, the team added blue dye in videos to better illustrate its use.

374.title: Loved Kohli's shot to reach his fifty vs GT, was just brilliant: Sachin
374.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar said Virat Kohli's shot to complete his half-century during his 73 off 54 balls against GT was just "brilliant", adding that he "loved" the shot. "At the last moment, he used his wrist to give it elevation," stated Sachin. "I really liked...the precision in his footwork and like they say showing the face of the bat," he said.

375.title: Delhi's peak power demand crosses 7,000 MW-mark, highest ever in May
375.article_body: Delhi's peak power demand rose to 7,070 MW (megawatts) on Thursday, the highest ever in May and this year's highest so far. Notably, the previous highest peak power demand for the month of May in Delhi was 6,780 MW on May 13, 2022. Delhi's peak power demand crossed the 7,000 MW-mark for the first time on July 10, 2018.

376.title: Diversity never caused any conflict in India: Rajnath Singh
376.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said India is the only country where people from different religions live in harmony and its diversity has never been the cause of any conflict. "Seventy-two sects of Muslim society are found in this country. India's oldest church dates back years ago," Singh said while addressing a religious gathering in Vadodara.

377.title: 33 die as strong winds, rains hit Bihar; CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
377.article_body: As many as 33 people have died in 16 districts of Bihar due to thunderstorms and lightning amid strong winds and heavy rains. CM Nitish Kumar announced ₹4 lakh ex-gratia each to the family of the deceased. "I'm deeply saddened to see that many people died in the incidents of thunderstorm and lightning in Bihar," PM Narendra Modi tweeted.

378.title: Dhanush sends legal notice to couple claiming him to be their biological son
378.article_body: Indian actor Dhanush and his father Kasthuri Raja have sent a court notice to a Madurai-based couple who claim that Dhanush is their biological son. In the notice, they have asked the couple to stop making "specious" claim regarding Dhanush. They have also requested the couple to publish a public statement admitting that all of their charges are baseless.

379.title: DC owner Parth Jindal trolled for his 'Never liked anyone doing any favours for us' tweet
379.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) owner Parth Jindal has been trolled for his tweet ahead of DC-MI match. "Never liked anyone doing any favours for us anyway...equation is simple...we win on Saturday and we get the opportunity of going further in IPL," he had written. Fans shared a video of DC players rooting for GT to defeat RCB by saying GT's slogan.

380.title: Which countries have reported cases of monkeypox so far?
380.article_body: More than 80 cases of monkeypox have been confirmed in at least 12 countries so far. Infections have been confirmed in nine European countries, as well as the US, Canada and Australia. Public health agencies in Europe have confirmed cases in UK, Spain, Portugal, Germany, Belgium, France, Netherlands, Italy and Sweden. There are now 20 confirmed cases in UK.

381.title: CBI officials misbehaved with Rabri Devi: RJD
381.article_body: After the CBI team raided Rabri Devi's residence in Patna for being accused in a corruption case, the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) alleged that CBI officials "misbehaved" with Rabri Devi and used "unparliamentary language" during their interrogation. "We reiterate that the latest CBI case and the raids conducted across the country...are sponsored by BJP," RJD's spokesperson said.

382.title: Villagers perform death ritual of Thane hospital to protest mismanagement
382.article_body: Residents of adjoining villages gathered outside the government-run Indira Gandhi Hospital in Thane's Bhiwandi area and performed the death ritual of the healthcare facility to protest its mismanagement on Friday. They brought a big portrait of the "dead" hospital, garlanded it and performed the mock death rituals to draw the management's attention towards lack of basic facilities at the hospital.

383.title: 7 die, 10 injured after vehicle rams into tree in Karnataka's Dharwad
383.article_body: At least seven persons died and 10 were injured after their vehicle rammed into a tree in Nigadi in Karnataka's Dharwad on Friday night, police said. The vehicle was carrying 21 people who were travelling to Benkankatti after attending a wedding, police stated. A case has been registered under section 304A of the IPC (causing death by negligence), police stated.

384.title: Maha govt concerned about bar operators rather than farmers: Fadnavis
384.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government was more concerned about bar operators and reducing the prices of foreign liquor than solving problems faced by farmers. The MVA government has not given a penny to those affected by storms and heavy rains, the former Maharashtra CM said at a farmers' rally in Solapur.

385.title: 40 people injured, houses damaged as tornado hits Germany
385.article_body: A tornado swept through parts of western Germany on Friday injuring around 40 people, "10 of them seriously", police said. The tornado damaged several homes, disrupted traffic and uprooted trees that toppled onto rail tracks and roads. The German Weather Service has warned that the stormy weather was set to continue. Police have asked locals to stay at home.

386.title: CBI raids brokers in Delhi, Mumbai & other cities in NSE co-location scam case
386.article_body: The CBI on Saturday carried out a coordinated search operation at over 10 locations in multiple cities in connection with the NSE co-location scam case. The searches will cover brokers at more than 12 premises in Mumbai, Delhi and Kolkata, among others. Notably, CBI has filed a chargesheet against former NSE CEO and MD Chitra Ramkrishna in the case.

387.title: I did not want to kill, I was nervous: Russian soldier who killed 62-year-old Ukrainian
387.article_body: A 21-year-old Russian soldier told a court that he "sincerely repented" killing an unarmed 62-year-old civilian in the northeast Ukrainian village of Chupakhivka on February 28. "I was nervous at the time, I did not want to kill...that's how it happened," Vadim Shishimarin said. Shishimarin is accused of firing several shots with an assault rifle at the civilian's head.

388.title: Nath praises BJP workers, says 'no one goes to tell them to work'
388.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath on Friday praised BJP workers, saying, "In the BJP, no one goes to tell the people on the ground that they have to go here or there and do so-and-so work." However, he added that Congress workers "wait for someone to tell them what to do". He further said that this was Congress' "only drawback".

389.title: Delhi govt gets 2 remote-controlled robots to help douse fires
389.article_body: The Delhi government has procured two remote-controlled fire fighting robots. While the robots are under trial, if they seem successful, more such machines will be introduced to the firefighting fleet, said Delhi Home Minister Satyendar Jain. The robots can release water at a high pressure of 2,400 litres/minute which will help in dousing fires faster.

390.title: Gang hacks man to death in broad daylight in TN; act caught on CCTV
390.article_body: Two people have surrendered in a court after a gang of four hacked a 36-year-old man to death in broad daylight on a road in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. The incident, captured on CCTV footage, shows the gang attacking the deceased as he falls on the road. An official said that the deceased had a few pending cases filed against him.

391.title: Oracle co-founder joined call about contesting Trump's defeat: Report
391.article_body: Oracle's billionaire Co-founder Larry Ellison participated in a November 2020 call in which US President Donald Trump's allies brainstormed ways to contest the results of the presidential election, media reports said citing an email. The phone call included Senator Lindsey Graham and longtime Trump legal adviser Jay Sekulow. Ellison had openly supported Trump during the 2020 campaign.

392.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad police arrest 88 history-sheeters in combing op
392.article_body: As many as 88 history-sheeters who were found violating rules were arrested by the Pimpri-Chinchwad police during a massive combing operation. According to the police, 130 criminals were checked during the drive against anti-social elements and offenders on record, in which all of the force's squads were activated. Flying squads were also deployed during the night, the police said.

393.title: Video of 'coal theft' in a Chhattisgarh's coal mine goes viral, probe ordered
393.article_body: The Chhattisgarh Police ordered a probe into a viral video that showed a large number of people digging and carrying away coal illegally from SECL's opencast coal mine in Chhattisgarh's Korba district. After the video went viral, Korba Collector Ranu Sahu visited the mines and claimed that no attempt was made by SECL to stop any such theft.

394.title: Releasing Warner SRH's biggest mistake, should've never let him go: Sehwag
394.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said releasing opener David Warner has been SRH's "biggest" mistake, adding that they should have never let him go irrespective of what happened. "SRH...should have backed Warner, which they did not do," stated Sehwag. "Anyone can have a poor season. Virat Kohli only recently scored that fifty otherwise his season has been really bad," said Sehwag.

395.title: 18-yr-old girl dies by suicide over being scolded for using phone in Thane
395.article_body: An 18-year-old girl died by suicide in Thane's Dombivli after her elder brother scolded her for spending too much time on her mobile phone. According to police, the deceased's brother had removed the SIM card from her phone before going to work on Thursday. On returning home, he found his sister hanging by a rod on the ceiling, police said.

396.title: Keep a close watch on monkeypox situation: Health Minister to officials
396.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has directed the officials at National Centre for Disease Control and ICMR to keep a close watch on the monkeypox situation. The airport and port health officers are asked to be vigilant. They have been reportedly instructed to isolate any sick passenger with a travel history to monkeypox-affected countries and send samples for investigation.

397.title: Zelenskyy proposes deal to secure Russian compensation for invasion
397.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy proposed a formal deal with the country's allies to obtain Russian compensation for the damage caused by its forces during war. Under the deal, Russian funds and property in signatory nations will be seized and directed to a special compensation fund, he added. "Russia will feel...weight of every missile...bomb...which it has fired at us," he said.

398.title: Ashwin's confidence in his ability found in very few players: Shastri
398.article_body: Reacting to RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin's 40* off 23 balls against CSK, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "His shot selection under pressure was outstanding. Ashwin targeted the right bowlers and pulled out the big strokes when needed." "The kind of confidence he has in his ability, you find that in very few cricketers," added Shastri.

399.title: Pit viper's venom neutralised with compound from fruits, vegetables
399.article_body: The venom of a pit viper can be neutralised using a substance found in fruits and vegetables, scientists said. They found that a modified version of the compound rutin, the water-soluble succinyl rutin, can delay the effect of a bite. The Bothrops jararaca is reportedly responsible for Brazil's roughly 26,000 recorded snake bites each year.

400.title: 'Tourists who want an exciting time can come', jokes Sri Lanka PM; video viral
400.article_body: During an interview, when asked if it is safe for tourists to visit Sri Lanka, PM Ranil Wickremesinghe joked that tourists who "want to have an exciting" time can come. He added, "Maybe they could take part in the demonstration" or hold placards against the President. Meanwhile, the journalist remarked that his question on tourism was a serious one.

401.title: Senior Shiromani Akali Dal leader Tota Singh passes away aged 81
401.article_body: Senior Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader and a three-time Punjab MLA Tota Singh passed away aged 81 at a private hospital in Mohali on Saturday after a prolonged illness. "He was a father figure to me...His invaluable advice...will always be missed," SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal tweeted. Tota Singh had served as the agriculture and education minister in Punjab.
